MOHELA currently has me on the standard repayment plan. i had been placed on a processing forbearance back in XXXX and in XXXX, i was placed on a general forebearance because of the SAVE injunction.

Sub-issue: Trouble with how payments are being handled
Consumer complaint narrative: The most recent problem is an ongoing one. I am the co-borrower on a joint consolidated loan. As per the Joint Consolidation Loan Separation Act signed into law on On XX/XX/XXXX, my ex-spouse and I are supposed to be granted an administrative forbearance until the loans have been separated. Over the past XXXX years, we have had the loan arbitrarily moved into and out of forbearance. I recently called Sloan Servicing after receiving a notice that we were behind on payments - payments that I wasn't aware we were required to make since we were in forbearance. This was on XX/XX/XXXX. I was told on that call that we would once again be put on forbearance until the loans were separated. Today, XX/XX/XXXX, I received a letter dated XX/XX/XXXX, stating that we were behind in payments once again. I feel as though we are being played with like this is a game and I do not appreciate it.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I have my unsubsidized, consolidated loan managed by MOHELA. I have been enrolled in the XXXX plan. Some time around XXXX of 2024, my loans have been transitioned to a new type of Forbearance called " Awaiting Form Administrative Forbearance ''. I have called the MOHELA help line at least XXXX times ( around XXXX and again last month ) regarding this and have repeatedly received inconsistent answers as to XXXX ) Why I am in this Forbearance and XXXX ) what can be done to rectify? 

According to " https : //www.ed.gov/higher-education/manage-your-loans/save-plan '', I should be enrolled in a general forbearance with no accumulating interest. And if I was in a processing forbearance, this should only last for 60 days following which I would again be put in a general forbearance with 0 % interest. I have not received any adequate explanation as to why I am still accumulating interest. 

Upon calling MOHELA the first time, I was told that everyone enrolled in the XXXX plan had their interest resumed in XXXX. After seeing this update from the Dept of Ed, I called MOHELA again and was told some accounts on the XXXX forbearance are still ( inappropriately ) accumulating interest and that my account would be corrected. This has yet to be done with no further communication.

Consumer complaint narrative:
You are hereby in RECEIPT OF NOTICE under the Fair Debt Collections Practices Act, XXXX XXXX, XXXX and XXXX regarding your above referenced file number and presented with a XXXX XXXX XXXX If you and your agency/firm can state your claim, please provide that information and fill out the enclosed IRS form XXXX. XXXX will also need you and your agency's/firm 's XXXX number to forward to IRS for collections via form XXXX stating you and your agency/firm 's taxable gain on any payments made or amounts you may incur in the self executing contract section if you pursue this matter without proof of claim. 

In an effort to settle this matter in the most efficient possible manner, Affiant hereby CONDITIONALLY ACCEPTS your demand for payment in the above named matter upon your complete and total fulfillment of the following conditions : Condition # XXXX A Notarized copy of the ORIGINAL WET INK SIGNED CONTRACT Pursuant 15 U.S.C. 1681 and all other supporting documentation that give rise to and lawfully support the alleged obligations your agency/firm now claims is owed. 

XXXX # XXXX Provide affiant with a sworn and notarized affidavit, signed under the penalty of perjury as follows : a. That your " client '' is the XXXX XXXX XXXX in interest and holder in due course of the aforementioned contract, and that they can and will further produce said ORIGINAL WET INK SIGNED CONTRACT Pursuant : Section XXXX of the ( Fair Credit Reporting Act and 15 U.S.C. 1681 in Condition # XXXX above. 

b. The names, addresses, dates, and durations of time during which any and all persons, corporations, associations, legal firms or any other parties and/or entities who XXXX have had or presently now have any interest in the collection or legal proceedings regarding this alleged obligation. 
c. That as a claimed debt collector, " you '' have not purchased evidence of this alleged debt and are proceeding solely in the name of the original contracting party or parties. 
d. That " you '' know, understand and agree that certain clauses in a contract of adhesion are unenforceable unless the party to whom the contract is extended could have selectively rejected the clause. 
e. That both " you and your firm '' have taken reasonable and prudent due diligence to verify that the amount claimed as owed is, in fact, a legitimate and bona fide debt, prior to instigating this action and making said claim, and that all relevant correspondence, challenges, denials, and counter claims by me have been fully and thoroughly reviewed by and adequately answered by " your firm '' both prior to and since initiating this claim. 
f. That since initiating this claim, your firm, or associates under your employ, did not fail to identify themselves as a debt collector in any manner or at any time pertaining to this alleged claim. 
g. That " you, your firm or associates under your employ '', did not fail to identify themselves as a debt collector in any manner or at any time pertaining to this alleged claim. 

XXXX # XXXX Provide written verification in the form of a signed, sworn and notarized affidavit from the stated creditor that you are authorized to act on their behalf in this alleged debt collection action. 

XXXX # XXXX Provide the total account and general ledger statement showing the full and complete accounting of the alleged obligation you are attempting to collect from me, signed and sworn to by the authorized person responsible for maintaining these records and having first-hand knowledge as to their accuracy and authenticity, and are able and willing to testify to the same under oath to that effect. 

XXXX # XXXX Provide certified and notarized copies of documents showing that " you '' are or represent a bona fide creditor in a collection process include : a. A notarized copy of a certified documents evidencing that you allowed to conduct business in the state of Florida as a collection agency. 

b. A notarized copy of the bond on file with the state of Florida allowing " you/your firm '' to operate as a collection agency XXXX XXXX notarized copy of the assignment letter including production of the signatures and status showing " your firm/agency '' as holders in due course of the alleged claim. 

XXXX # XXXX Provide the status and enforcing regulations, both Federal and State, which clearly and unequivocally make me liable for this alleged debt. 

XXXX # XXXX Provide the statutes and enforcing regulations, both Federal and State, which clearly and unequivocally allow for the collection of this alleged debt. 

XXXX # XXXX Provide proof that your " Notice of Debt Collection '', is authorized by such statutes and enforcing regulations. 

XXXX # XXXX Provide proof of all relevant signatures and your status as holders in due course of this alleged claim. 

XXXX # XXXX Provide the name ( s ), address ( es ) and telephone number ( s ) of the bona fide creditor ( s ) pertaining to this alleged debt. 

XXXX # XXXX If you are acting as an agent, provide certified copies of the registered claim upon which you are collecting, showing the name ( s ) of any and all debtors and the respective bona fide creditor ( s ) as the secured party ( s ) Condition # XXXX Provide the national and regional credit and debit card network rules and regulations governing electronic payments and ATM transactions ; specifically the production of all versions of the manual in each case for each service/buyer/successor/transferee regarding this alleged claim. 

XXXX # XXXX Provide a sworn and notarized affidavit, signed under the penalty of perjury, that all the rules and regulations of the XXXX and XXXX credit and debit card network rules and regulations were never, at any time, violated or circumvented to the detriment of the affiant pertaining to this alleged claim. 

XXXX # XXXX Provide verifiable proof that any actual " money/federal debt notes '' was ever created or loaned to affiant by the named " creditor ( XXXX ) '' whom " you '' claim to represent, and not mere bookkeeping entries that were made by them in an attempt to establish the alleged obligation or debt, and in which case, the entire matter would constitute fraud on " their '' part, as well as now " yours ''. 

NOTICE : Contacting affiant or affiants residence ( XXXX ), address ( es ) again without first properly documenting that affiant has any obligation to you or your claimant pertaining to the above referenced trust numbers, after verifiable receipt of this Notice of Conditional XXXX, will establish and constitute that " you '' deliberately intended to use interstate communications in a scheme of fraud by using further threats, intimidations, deceptions and/or enticements to coerce affiant to commit some act creating a legal obligation and/or XXXX where none exists, previously or presently, as well as constituting that " you and/or your firm '' knew or should have known that by such communications, what " you '' have heretofore attempted to do was, and is, false and therefore unlawful. Moreover, until or unless you have fully satisfied all of my demands and claims as stated herein and previously, as well as provided by numerous laws and regulations, both Federal and State, pertaining to this alleged claim, which the courts and/or others who rely upon such written communication may well judge such acts by " you '' as deliberately intended to impair or damage my credit rating, my reputation, my standing in the community as well as to intentionally inflict financial and emotional harm upon me, and be assured that " you/your firm/agency '' do so at " your '' own peril and risk. 

You have XXXX ( XXXX ) days from the receipt of this Conditional XXXX to respond on a point-by-point basis, via sworn affidavit, under " your '' full commercial liability, signing under penalty of perjury, that the facts contained therein are true, correct and complete, and not misleading in any manner whatsoever. Declarations are an insufficient response, as declarations permit lying by omissions, which no honorable draft may contain.

Your failure to accept my Conditional Offer of Settlement by producing each and every requested answer, record and/or documentation, or in the alternative, sending me written withdrawal of your claim, ( summary judgement ), will constitute your stipulation that I/Affiant have no duty or obligation to any portion of the above aforementioned debt whatsoever, and that you have no right or basis to pursue any further collection. 

Be advised that notice to any agent of the State or under courts regarding this Conditional Offer of Acceptance is considered notice to any and all principals. Further, " your '' failure to fully and completely respond on a point-by-point basis, as well as ANY ACTIVITY by " you or your firm '' to secure payment with a " Writ of Garnishment '' before responding to this Conditional Acceptance shall be deemed as an Agreement with the facts as stated in the attached affidavit, and shall be further deemed an Automatic Dishonor of the Conditional Acceptance and agreement to the Courts to the immediate payment of {$75000.00} USD, payable to XXXX XXXX XXXX as compensating damages .

Signed from " without '' the " United States '' in accordance with 28 U.S.C., Sec. 1746 ( 1 ). All rights are reserved without prejudice and without recourse, UCC1-308 and RCW 62A.1-207 I have disputed this unlawful debt ; therefore, until validated " you '' know " your '' information concerning this debt is inaccurate. Thus, if " you '' have already reported this " debt '' to any credit-reporting agencies ( CRA ) 's or credit bureaus ( CB ) 's and/or any Governmental Agencies then, " you '' must immediately inform them of my dispute with this " debt ''. Reporting information that " you '' know to be inaccurate or failing to report information correctly violates the Fair Credit Reporting Act UCC 1681s-2. Should " you '' pursue a judgement without validating this alleged " debt '', the appropriate departments of the Secretary of State and Attorney General will be notified and forwarded this information and " your '' failure to comply with the FDCPA and for reservation of rights shall be noted.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Immediate Action Needed : Approve Outstanding Borrower Defense Applications To the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, We are writing as a collective group of defrauded students and alumni who attended XXXX schools, urging immediate action to approve outstanding Borrower Defense XXXX and provide full relief for those impacted. 
Many of us attended the following institutions owned by or affiliated with XXXX, where misrepresentations and predatory practices have been well-documented : * XXXX University XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX University XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX University XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX University XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX University XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Department of Education has XXXX found significant evidence of misconduct by these schools. Specifically, XXXX University misrepresented job placement rates to prospective students between XXXX and XXXX, falsely claiming that 90 % of graduates secured jobs in their field of study within XXXX months of graduation. This claim, widely advertised in national campaigns and direct mailings, was later revealed to be grossly inaccurate. XXXX included old jobs held by mid-career students before enrolling and excluded graduates who found employment outside their field of study. 
At its peak, XXXX enrolled nearly XXXX students across campuses in XXXX states and through an online program accessible nationwide. The scale of this deception has left countless students burdened with unmanageable debt and limited opportunities, as documented in the Department XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Summary and Statements of Facts.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Immediate Action Needed : Approve Outstanding Borrower Defense Applications To the Departments Overseeing School & Loan Server Compliance, We are writing as a collective group of defrauded students and alumni who attended XXXXaffiliated schools, urging immediate action to approve outstanding Borrower Defense applications and provide full relief for those impacted. 

Many of us attended the following institutions owned by or affiliated with XXXX, where misrepresentations and predatory practices have been well-documented : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX has already found significant evidence of misconduct by these schools. Specifically, XXXX University misrepresented job placement rates to prospective students between XXXX and XXXX, falsely claiming that 90 % of graduates secured jobs in their field of study within six months of graduation. This claim, widely advertised in national campaigns and direct mailings, was later revealed to be grossly inaccurate. XXXX included old jobs held by mid-career students before enrolling and excluded graduates who found employment outside their field of study. 

At its peak, XXXX enrolled nearly 70,000 students across campuses in 26 states and through an online program accessible nationwide. The scale of this deception has left countless students burdened with unmanageable debt and limited opportunities, as documented in the Department of Educations Borrower Defense Executive Summary and Statements of Facts.

We are asking you to take immediate steps to : 1. Approve all outstanding Borrower Defense applications for students who attended these institutions.

2. Discharge all loans associated with fraudulent practices, including consolidated loans.

3. Repair borrowers credit reports to reflect the removal of these fraudulent debts. 

Delaying action only prolongs the harm caused by these predatory institutions, leaving borrowers unable to move forward with their lives. Many of us pursued higher education to achieve the American Dream, but this dream was stolen by the very institutions we trusted to help us achieve it. 

We implore you to act decisively to ensure justice for all borrowers who were misled and exploited. The stakes are simply too high to risk further delays. 

Thank you for your attention to this urgent matter. 

Sincerely, Students & Graduates of XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am submitting this formal complaint and demand for immediate student loan forgiveness due to the violation of my rights under the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act ( FERPA ) by the U.S. Department of Education ( DOE ) and its unauthorized association with the Department of Government Efficiency ( DOGE ), led by XXXX XXXX. As recent reports indicate, DOGE has unlawfully accessed student loan records, compromising sensitive borrower information, including mine. 
As a federal student loan borrower, I have the right to privacy regarding my educational and financial records. The unlawful access and potential misuse of my student loan data constitute a serious violation of FERPA. This breach has eroded my trust in the integrity of federal student loan management and has created significant risks, including identity theft, unauthorized loan modifications, and financial harm. 
Given the egregious nature of this breach, I formally demand that the CFPB take the following immediate actions : XXXX. Full discharge and forgiveness of my federal student loans due to the governments failure to protect my data. 
XXXX. A formal confirmation of whether my records were accessed or compromised. 
XXXX. A full report on how my data has been handled during this breach. 
XXXX. Immediate enforcement actions against those responsible for this violation.

This FERPA violation constitutes gross negligence by the Department of Education and DOGE, directly impacting my financial and personal security. Due to the governments failure to safeguard my data, I am no longer obligated to repay these loans and demand full forgiveness. 

Please confirm receipt of this demand and provide a timeline for loan forgiveness and resolution. I expect swift action on this matter and will pursue further legal avenues if necessary.
Company: Servicer under contract with Federal Student Aid

Consumer complaint narrative: I requested information regarding what my payments would be after switching my payment plan from the XXXX plan to the XXXX ( XXXX XXXX ) plan in order to apply for a home mortgage. I needed this information quickly due to the closing date on our home. I was told repeatedly that the requested information would arrive via email and via mail and via fax within hours. I called once on XX/XX/XXXX and was told that I would receive an letter in the mail that was escalated. I never received the letter, as of XX/XX/XXXX. I called XXXX  times on XX/XX/XXXX and was explicitly told that I would receive an email within the hour and, if not, the next morning ( XX/XX/XXXX ). I was told on that same call that if I did not receive the email with the requested document that I should call back that evening or the next morning. I was also told that the representative had spoken multiple times with their supervisor and the issue had been escalated. The confidence of the person I spoke with on the phone made me relax so I didn't call back until the morning of XX/XX/XXXX. When I called that next morning, and XXXX other times during the day, since I did not receive the requested document in my email, I was told different things each time. I was told once that the email would be showing up in my inbox shortly ( within the hour ) and that I should just wait. I was told another time that I should be looking in my Aidvantage inbox for the document shortly before being disconnected while on hold. Another time I was speaking with a representative for a couple minutes before being hung up on. Another time I called I was told that I should never have been told that I could receive this document via email and that documents like this can only be sent via physical mail or via fax. This contradicted every previous call. I have now been told that I should wait for a fax to arrive monday ( XX/XX/XXXX ) with the requested document but I have no way to trust that this will actually happen.

Consumer complaint narrative:
In XXXX I was placed in an involuntary forbearance due to account migration. I contacted Mohela and asked them if this would impact my payments for my public service loan forgiveness. I was informed to know that that would have no impact. I advised them I did not want to be placed in forbearance as my loan was due on the XXXX, the forbearance was placed on the XXXX, and the account migration should be done in plenty of time to be able to make my payment without incurring a late fee. Mohela agreed and said that I should be able to make my payment once the migration was done and that they would remove the forbearance. That did not happen. I submitted my PSLF forms which have been denied repeatedly because that XXXX payment has not been applied due to the forbearance that I was involuntarily placed that was unnecessary for my account. The letter received from Mohela informed me that This would have no impact upon my loan. Yet it has prevented me from public service loan forgiveness. I made my payment on XX/XX/year>. Thus my loans should be forgiven or in the process of public service loan forgiveness. On XX/XX/XXXX I contacted Mohela once again and their staff informed me that they would remove the forbearance for XXXX and XXXX in order for me to be allowed to be considered for forgiveness. That still has not happened. I've been repeatedly lied to by staff at Mohela. I've tried everything in my power to try to resolve this issue including requesting a reconsideration which nothing has happened with, requesting to be placed back into repayment so I could make my one payment in order to have my loans forgiven nothing has happened with it either. I have requested to buy back a month and that application has not been processed. I have also requested reconsideration of my payment counts and nothing has progressed with it. I have submitted at least 11 complaints to try to resolve this issue. I have made 122 payments on this loan. My loan should have been forgiven months ago I want this escalated to the Department of Education. Not to mention I have filed three complaints with the OIG. I have made numerous phone calls and contacted both the servicer and XXXX XXXX designated communication methods. 
As I have been actively trying to resolve this issue for 6 months. I am requesting immediate discharge of my student loans due to servicer misconduct and based upon the misconduct of The Department of Education Student Aid Department. Their website specifically states this account migration will not impact my loans ' forgiveness and yet it has due to the denial of the XXXX Payment for MOHELA 's involuntary placement of my account in forbearance. I have filed an OIG complaint that also includes screenshots of the Student Aid Website 's information about Mohela 's account migration. Along with proof of payment made with my bank statement, and a screen shot of payment counts from Mohela 's website. I'm tired of the constant delays and I've also disputed the debt with the credit bureaus.

XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX, or Mohela, sent me ongoing emails regarding student loan repayment with the following information being the latest : " Your Student Loan Payment is Due : XX/XX/year> Current Due : {$3300.00} Past Due : {$10000.00} Total Due : {$13000.00} " What Mohela fail to understand is that I am currently enrolled in school, should ne on loan deferment, and my loans, as agreed, should not kick in for repayment until 6 months after my expected graduation later this year or Spring of next year. Because is has been month of delinquency, per Mohela, they have now sent me a delinquency cascading letter as a threat. 

Please note that I have reached out to Mohela to clarify this issue to no avail, as they have high call volume over 30 minutes with no customer service specialist answering the phone and with no response online after I sent a message to them addressing this issue. I also tried to reach out to my institution, XXXX University, to figure out why Mohela is billing me for repayment while I am enrolled in school and why there is a gap of communication between them and Mohela. The institution usually notifies them with verification of my enrollment. 

Your consideration and assistance regarding this matter is greatly appreciated.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I have met the requirements for loans to be forgiven under PSLF. My employment certification forms verify that I have completed more than the necessary time in XXXX XXXXXXXX Only 116 of 120 payments have been counted due to SAVE forbearance. My only options have been to switch off SAVE onto different payment plan or to apply for XXXX  and I have submitted paperwork to do both of these. I have not gotten a response for either option. 
Submitted XXXX  Reconsideration request on XX/XX/24. Case # XXXX. I have contacted FSA weekly or biweekly since this request has been submitted. Originally I was told to wait 45 business days. After that time I was told that my case had been " escalated '' but was provided no information about what that means. I have asked for a supervisor to call me back on at least two occasions and that has not happened. I have been told conflicting things every time I call. I have been told that there is no one I can talk to who can provide me more information.

Submitted to switch off SAVE plan onto IDR repayment plan. Application was received on XX/XX/24. I have not been moved to a processing forbearance and have no information about when I might be moved onto different plan. 
This agency needs to be held accountable for holding student loan borrowers hostage with no options to move forward and no transparency. I have more than upheld my end of the agreement in my PSLF promissory notes. The delay in forgiveness is costing me both financially and emotionally. I am not able to make career decisions that would benefit me and the patients I care for because I am stuck. The lack of transparency and communication should be illegal.

Consumer complaint narrative:
First thing this company ( Mohela ) did is rescind my student loan forgiveness that occurred in XX/XX/XXXX. They rescinded my student loan forgiveness on XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX XXXX after forgiveness and after it was reported to the three credit bureaus stating that my student loans have been paid in full. Still don't understand how this is allowed to happen, but here we are almost XXXX XXXX later and nothing has been done. You all are still a bunch of crooks and only care about the bottom line and not helping out borrowers. 

Fast forward to the month of XX/XX/XXXX and I have been placed on Forbearance because my loans are associated with the XXXX XXXX and because this nonsense is currently being handled by the judicial system because some state Republican Attorney Generals decided to sue the XXXX XXXX on the XXXX XXXX and they think it's okay to mess with the lives of working Americans currently in student loan debt ( they want us to be in debt forever ). I received a letter/email correspondence on XX/XX/XXXX via my Mohela account stating I am on Forbearance due to being on the XXXX XXXX and no interest will accrue on my account starting on XX/XX/XXXX. Though I called Mohela several times asking when the interest will stop accruing on my account, I was told " it takes time and it needs to be done manually and the interest will be added back after a review is done. '' I made three payments : one on XX/XX/XXXX, another on XX/XX/XXXX, and a third on XX/XX/XXXX. The three payments have interest associated with them even though I wasn't supposed to have interest accruing on my student loan account. I called Mohela several times to resolve this issue. The last phone call I had about this issue ( I don't remember the date because I have just stopped collecting the dates I have communicated with this crooked company ) with Mohela was with a BRAND NEW Mohela employee. I asked when the interest that was collected will be taken off the principal balance. The BRAND NEW employee stated she is not equipped to do this and " I need to transfer you to a supervisor. '' I got transferred after talking with the BRAND NEW useless Mohela employee and was on hold for almost an HOUR! I hung up because nobody was going to help me and they weren't going to reflect the interest that accrued back on my principal balance. 

They also added additional interest that was pending for one of the loans to the principal balance after interest stopped accruing at the end of XX/XX/XXXX. The total interest they states was " unpaid '' is {$84.00}. This " unpaid '' interest shouldn't even be on my principal balance since it was accrued during my Forbearance period. I am on Forbearance because I am on the XXXX XXXX and I should NOT be paying interest. 

My current principal is estimated at {$77000.00} as of XX/XX/XXXX. In my payment history of my Mohela account. Right now, the principal balance SHOULD be at {$76000.00}. 

Let me type this again so that it is not missed, interest stopped accruing on my account at the END OF XX/XX/XXXX when it was supposed to STOP accruing on XX/XX/XXXX. And Mohela added an additional {$84.00} of accrued " unpaid '' interest back to my principal balance without notifying me. They thought I would not notice the balance change and I know you all are going to come up with some B.S. excuse about it. 

So, to summarize, I was on XXXX forbearance on XX/XX/XXXX. Called Mohela to verify and they stated it the 0 % interest needed to be done manually and that the interest will be reflected on my balance once the 0 % interest has been made to my account. I made three payments with interest associated with them and the interest is not reflected on my principal balance due to Mohela 's incompetence. And there is no record of them putting the interest back on my principal balance. When interest stopped accruing on my account at the end of XXXX, there was {$84.00} of accrued " unpaid '' interest that was then added to my principal balance sometime towards the end of XXXX. I have called multiple times and no action has been taken. It has been almost XXXXXXXX XXXX.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to express my concern and frustration regarding several issues I have encountered with MOHELA. Despite numerous attempts to resolve these matters, I have yet to receive any satisfactory response or resolution. 
Firstly, I have been unable to reach MOHELA by phone. Each time I call, I am met with excessively long wait times, only to be disconnected or transferred without ever speaking to a representative. This lack of customer support is unacceptable and has caused me significant inconvenience. 
Secondly, my online account with MOHELA was abruptly canceled without any prior notice or explanation. This has left me unable to access my account information, email or manage my account effectively. I rely on the online portal to stay informed, view my payment history and communication with MOHELA via secure email, and its cancellation has been highly disruptive. 
Most concerningly, I have made several payments in 2024 that were not applied to my account as my account was moved to the Department of Education. These payments have not been refunded, and I have no clear understanding of their status. This situation has caused unnecessary financial strain and anxiety. 
I request that these issues be addressed immediately : 1. Provide a reliable and accessible phone support system to ensure that customers can reach a representative without undue delay.

2. Restore my online account or provide a clear explanation for its cancellation, along with instructions on how I can communicate with MOHELA via secure email as telephone calls are not timely answered.

3. Refund the payments made in 2024 that were not applied to my account and provide a detailed account statement reflecting payments applied to my loan balance prior to transferring to Department of Education.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally file a complaint against Mohela, my federal student loan servicer, for what I believe to be improper and potentially unlawful payment processing practices. 

I have attempted to make payments toward my federal student loans, specifying amounts for individual loans. This has happened over several months of payment but the most recent was today XX/XX/XXXX. However, Mohela is altering my payment allocations without my consent, preventing me from applying my payments as intended. I understand that this issue has been raised in the past, and I am concerned that their current practices may still be in violation of federal student loan servicing regulations. 

Issue Details : Loan Servicer : Mohela Loan Type : Federal student loans Problem Encountered : When I attempt to allocate specific payment amounts to each loan, Mohela overrides my instructions and redistributes the payments differently. 
This prevents me from managing my loans effectively, potentially causing unintended interest accrual or delays in my repayment strategy. 

I have a recording of me attempting to pay the individual loan allocation and the platform not allowing me to allocate individual payment amounts and it auto resetting that I can provide.
Company public response: Company believes it acted appropriately as authorized by contract or law

After graduation, I started receiving bills from federal and private loans totaling over {$50000.00}.

Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally lodge a complaint regarding the unauthorized access and breach of my educational records, financial aid data, and IRS tax information by the U.S. Department of Education ( DOE ) and the Department of Governmental Efficiency ( DOGE ). This breach constitutes a direct violation of the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act ( FERPA ) and Title IV regulations, as well as an egregious violation of my personal privacy and financial security. 

I recently discovered that my sensitive and legally protected records were accessed and potentially shared without my consent. This includes but is not limited to : 1. My academic records and personally identifiable information ( PII ). 
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) data, including financial aid history and loan information. 
XXXX. My IRS tax transcripts, which were obtained and used without proper authorization. 
These actions violate my rights under FERPA ( 20 U.S.C. 1232g ; 34 CFR Part 99 ), which grants me the right to control access to my educational records, as well as Title IV of the Higher Education Act, which governs the use and protection of federal student aid information. Furthermore, unauthorized access to my IRS tax data raises serious concerns regarding potential identity theft, fraud, and violations of federal data security standards.
Company public response: Company believes it acted appropriately as authorized by contract or law

Consumer complaint narrative: As a XXXX  borrower pursuing XXXX, I was placed in the XXXX Forbearance in the XXXX  of XXXX. Sadly, I learned from XXXX that the time spent in the XXXX Forbearance would not count towards XXXX credit. I have desired, and still do desire, to exit the XXXX  Forbearance -- and move immediately back into repayment on my federal student loans. I submitted an electronic XXXX  Request XX/XX/XXXX, on the FSA.gov website, with full intention of switching my repayment plan over to XXXX. My federal student loan servicer -- MOHELA -- has indicated that they have received my electronic XXXX  Request. But now here we are in the new year, XXXX, and MOHELA has done nothing at all. Absolutely nothing. And I have spent hours on hold trying to speak with representatives to get some sort of explanation as to what is going on. And even when I do get through to a customer service representative, no one can give me a straight answer about what in the world is going on, and why can't I switch repayment plans -- which XXXX has stated that borrowers such as myself can switch to a different repayment plan. It is not acceptable for MOHELA, my federal student loan servicer, to do nothing, when I am trying to do something. They are supposed to be providing service. I can tell you from first-hand experience that this has been a miserable experience trying to deal with MOHELA. I have felt like I am trapped in an endless tunnel with no hope of exit with MOHELA.

Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/year>, I received a document from Aidvantage saying that my student loans were placed into a forbearance due to the issues with the XXXX program and my interest rate would be set to 0 % and I would not accumulate interest during this time. However, I recently checked my balance and found that I have accumulated interest. I have not received any sort of documentation or notification stating that my interest rate had changed and that I had begun accumulating interest once again. I do not even know my current interest rate. My notifications show a 0 % capitalized interest rate and yet my balance keeps growing even though I have been making additional payments that are not required at this time.

Consumer complaint narrative: At XXXX  XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX I attended at this university in XXXX. They charged me a full year term class tuition for an empty class meaning no staff, no students, no class work it was an empty class that doesnt even exist in faculty records. I submitted documentation for the removal of this class from my transcripts for the years term and for my financial aid. They denied me approval for my documentation stating that it was not a class but stated that I already took the class for a year which is empty and that they can not remove grades or conduct scores off my transcript since the school year has ended. They charged me over XXXX plus interest for not paying and suspended me for a year because this empty class lowered my GPA and Conduct score for me to pass freshman year in college. I want this removed immediately from my credit report as XXXX of the hard inquiries that is stated on my credit report with XXXX XXXX. This University is the most absolute most terrible college to ever attend to. Given they do not care for ones education but only how much money they receive from students. Knowing I have a millennial scholarship and received financial aid, they knew keeping this on my transcripts and conduct score that I will not be eligible for my millennial scholarship and financial aid no longer because of guidelines to follow for eligibility for financial aid. And this is all from an empty class all my other classes and conduct scores were above XXXX and a conduct score of satisfactory. This institution discriminated against me and charged me knowing it would impact my credit score and suspended me for a year knowing if I even tried to continue my education I would not be eligible for financial aid.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing this complaint due to concerns about the unauthorized access and handling of my personal student loan information by the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  ). I learned through recent news reports that XXXX has been given access to sensitive student loan data managed by the Department of Education and its loan servicers. This raises serious privacy concerns, as I have not authorized the sharing of my personal loan information with this department. 

On XX/XX/year>, I contacted my loan servicer, Aidvantage, via email to inquire whether my data had been shared with XXXX under what authority, and what specific information may have been accessed. I also stated that if my information had been shared without proper authorization, I would like to know the process for filing a formal complaint. 

Since I have just sent this request, I am awaiting a response from Aidvantage. However, given the sensitive nature of this issue, I am seeking federal oversight to ensure my data privacy is being protected. I also plan to send a certified letter to Aidvantage to formally document my request. 

I request that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau investigate this matter and ensure that my personal student loan information is not being accessed or misused without my explicit consent.

Consumer complaint narrative: I was previously enrolled in public student loan forgiveness ( PSLF ) and my loan servicer, MOHELA, discharged my loans earlier in 2024 after making on-time monthly payments over the course of 10 yrs. That said, I wound up making 123 out of the required 120 monthly payments and MOHELA has yet to refund my three overpayments in excess of {$1400.00} as they have promised. I have escalated this issue several times to the highest level with MOHELA and still haven't received a dime. Their customer service said it could take up to 90 days to process the refund, not one 1+ yrs! As you can imagine, I'm extremely frustrated with their company. Interestingly, MOHELA has a pending lawsuit for their egregious handling of student loans and refunds for borrowers. I'm hoping you can help because I feel like I'm being ignored!

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Formal Complaint Regarding Data Breach, FERPA and Title IV Violations, and Request for Immediate Discharge of Student Loans Dear DEPT OF ED/AIDVANTAGE, I am writing to formally lodge a complaint regarding the unauthorized access and breach of my educational records, financial aid data, and IRS tax XXXXnformation by the U.S. Department of Education ( DOE ) and the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  ( XXXX ). This breach constitutes a direct violation of the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act ( FERPA ) and Title IV regulations, as well as an egregious violation of my personal privacy and financial security. 
I recently discovered that my sensitive and legally protected records were accessed and potentially shared without my consent. This includes but is not limited to : XXXX. My academic records and personally identifiable information ( PII ). 
XXXX. My Free Application for XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) data, including financial aid history and loan information. 
XXXX. My IRS tax transcripts, which were obtained and used without proper authorization. 
These actions violate my rights under FERPA ( 20 U.S.C. 1232g ; 34 CFR Part 99 ), which grants me the right to control access to my educational records, as well as Title IV of the Higher Education Act, which governs the use and protection of federal student aid information. Furthermore, unauthorized access to my IRS tax data raises serious concerns regarding potential identity theft, fraud, and violations of federal data security standards. 
Given the severity of this breach and the direct impact on my financial security and privacy, I demand the following corrective actions : 1. Immediate discharge and cancellation of all my federal student loans due to the breach of my financial aid and tax records, which invalidates the integrity of my loan agreements.

2. A formal investigation into this data breach, including details on how my records were accessed, who accessed them, and for what purpose.

3. A full report on the extent of my data exposure and the corrective measures being implemented to prevent future violations.

4. Immediate notification to XXXX  XXXX  credit bureaus ( XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX XXXX ) to place a fraud alert and investigate any unauthorized activity that may have resulted from this breach.

This breach has caused significant distress and concern regarding the security of my personal and financial data. If my demands are not met within 30 days, I will be left with no choice but to escalate this matter through legal channels, including filing complaints with the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), and pursuing legal action against the responsible parties. 
I request a written response addressing these concerns and outlining the immediate actions being taken to remedy this situation. Please direct all correspondence to the address listed above. 
Thank you for your prompt attention to this urgent matter. I look forward to your immediate response and resolution. 
Sincerely,

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally file a complaint under the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act ( FERPA ) regarding the unauthorized access to my personally identifiable information by Elon Musk and his employees through the Department of Educations databases. 

On or around XX/XX/year>, I became aware that individuals associated with Elon Musk, who are neither school officials nor authorized representatives, accessed databases that include my personal education records without my knowledge or consent. I am aware that usage of databases is monitored, recorded and/or subjected to audit. I did not provide any authorization for such access, and I believe this constitutes a violation of my FERPA rights.

To my understanding, the Department of Education is required to safeguard students personal records and only grant access to authorized parties under FERPA guidelines. The unauthorized access by private individuals or corporate representatives is a serious breach of these protections.

A complaint has been filed with the US Department of Education Student Privacy Policy Office, Federal Student Aid ( FSA ), the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, Ohio Attorney General, and my current loan holder. 

I respectfully request that your office investigate this matter and take the appropriate action to ensure my personal information remains protected. Please provide me with any relevant findings, corrective actions, and steps I can take to prevent further unauthorized access to my records.

Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/XXXX, I submitted my income recertification for my income driven repayment plan ( PAYE ). This is submitted on studentaid.gov and then they immediately forward it to your loan servicer for them to process. I did the recommended method which is giving them access to your tax returns and tax information so they stated this should work quickly/smoothly. Studentaid.gov immediately forwarded my income recertification to Mohela on XX/XX/XXXX. Since that time, Mohela 's status of my income recertification simply says " In Review ''. In the meantime, they are sending me a bill that will be due XX/XX/XXXX for the full loan amount, not the income driven repayment/PAYE amount. I obviously can not afford this. When I try to contact or call Mohela, they either put me on hold for XXXX hours or give me the run around, or hang up. They have yet to answer these XXXX questions for me : XXXX ) How long will it take for them to process my income recertification? They have access to my income tax returns so it should be pretty simple XXXX ) If you can not get this processed by XX/XX/XXXX, could you please put my loans in forbearance until you are able to process it? I can not pay the full amount and this is certainly not my fault since I submitted the recertification application XXXX months ago.

Consumer complaint narrative:
What I reported to XXXX : To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally report a violation of my privacy rights concerning my student loan information. My personal and financial information was compromised without my authorization, which constitutes a breach of confidentiality and a direct violation of multiple federal laws protecting student records and personal data.

The Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act ( FERPA ) ensures the confidentiality of student records, and this breach represents a clear violation of my rights under this law. Additionally, the Privacy Act of 1974 establishes a code of fair information practices governing the collection, maintenance, use, and dissemination of personal information by federal agencies. The unauthorized access and potential misuse of my data directly contradict these protections.

Furthermore, Higher Education Laws and Policies exist to safeguard future borrowers from improper data sharing and unauthorized access. Allowing a third-party entity, specifically Elon Musk , to access and use student loan data without proper authorization is a severe breach of these legal standards. This unauthorized access not only jeopardizes my financial security but also sets a dangerous precedent for future borrowers. 

Given the severity of this breach and the compromise of my personal and financial information, I demand an immediate investigation into this matter. I also request the full cancellation and discharge of my student loan due to the mishandling of my data, which has resulted in a significant breach of my privacy rights. 
I expect a prompt response detailing the actions being taken to address this issue and ensure that such breaches do not occur in the future. Please confirm receipt of this complaint and provide me with updates regarding the investigation and resolution.

I am writing to formally lodge a complaint regarding the unauthorized access and breach of my educational records, financial aid data, and IRS tax information by the U.S. Department of Education ( DOE ) and the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ). This breach constitutes a direct violation of the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act ( FERPA ) and Title IV regulations, as well as an egregious violation of my personal privacy and financial security. 
I recently discovered that my sensitive and legally protected records were accessed and potentially shared without my consent. This includes but is not limited to : 1. My academic records and personally identifiable information ( PII ).

2. My Free Application for XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) data, including financial aid history and loan information. 
XXXX. My IRS tax transcripts, which were obtained and used without proper authorization. 
These actions violate my rights under FERPA ( 20 U.S.C. 1232g ; 34 CFR Part 99 ), which grants me the right to control access to my educational records, as well as Title IV of the Higher Education Act, which governs the use and protection of federal student aid information.

Furthermore, unauthorized access to my IRS tax data raises serious concerns regarding potential identity theft, fraud, and violations of federal data security standards.

Given the severity of this breach and the direct impact on my financial security and privacy, I demand the following corrective actions : 1. Immediate discharge and cancellation of all my federal student loans due to the breach of my financial aid and tax records, which invalidates the integrity of my loan agreements. 
2. A formal investigation into this data breach, including details on how my records were accessed, who accessed them, and for what purpose.

3. A full report on the extent of my data exposure and the corrective measures being implemented to prevent future violations.

4. Immediate notification to XXXX XXXX  credit bureaus ( XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX XXXX ) to place a fraud alert and investigate any unauthorized activity that may have resulted from this breach. 
This breach has caused significant distress and concern regarding the security of my personal and financial data. If my demands are not met within 30 days, I will be left with no choice but to escalate this matter through legal channels, including filing complaints with the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), and pursuing legal action against the responsible parties. 
I request a written response addressing these concerns and outlining the immediate actions being taken to remedy this situation. Please direct all correspondence to the address listed above. 
Thank you for your prompt attention to this urgent matter. I look forward to your immediate response and resolution

Consumer complaint narrative:
Immediate Action Needed : Approve Outstanding Borrower Defense Applications To the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, We are writing as a collective group of defrauded students and alumni who attended XXXXaffiliated schools, urging immediate action to approve outstanding Borrower Defense applications and provide full relief for those impacted. 
Many of us attended the following institutions owned by or affiliated with XXXX, where misrepresentations and predatory practices have been well-documented : * XXXX University XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX University XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX University XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX University XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX University XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Department of Education has already found significant evidence of misconduct by these schools. Specifically, XXXX University misrepresented job placement rates to prospective students between XXXX and XXXX, falsely claiming that 90 % of graduates secured jobs in their field of study within six months of graduation. This claim, widely advertised in national campaigns and direct mailings, was later revealed to be grossly inaccurate. XXXX included old jobs held by mid-career students before enrolling and excluded graduates who found employment outside their field of study. 
At its peak, XXXX enrolled nearly 70,000 students across campuses in 26 states and through an online program accessible nationwide. The scale of this deception has left countless students burdened with unmanageable debt and limited opportunities, as documented in the Department of Educations Borrower Defense Executive Summary and Statements of Facts.

We are asking you to take immediate steps to : 1. Approve all outstanding Borrower Defense applications for students who attended these institutions.

2. Discharge all loans associated with fraudulent practices, including consolidated loans.

3. Repair borrowers credit reports to reflect the removal of these fraudulent debts.

Delaying action only prolongs the harm caused by these predatory institutions, leaving borrowers unable to move forward with their lives. Many of us pursued higher education to achieve the American Dream, but this dream was stolen by the very institutions we trusted to help us achieve it.

We implore you to act decisively to ensure justice for all borrowers who were misled and exploited. The stakes are simply too high to risk further delays. 
Thank you for your attention to this urgent matter. 
Sincerely, Students & Graduates of XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
Product : Student Loan Issue : My student loan servicer mishandled my information Company Name : Aidvantage ( Maximus Education, XXXX ) Unauthorized Access to My Student Loan Records Request for Loan Discharge I am filing this complaint because my personally identifiable information ( PII ) and federal student loan records were improperly accessed and disclosed without my consent due to a data breach involving the U.S. Department of Education and its student loan servicing systems.

According to multiple news reports, unauthorized individuals affiliated with XXXX XXXX Department of Government Engineering ( DOGE ) team gained access to federal student loan databases, including those managed by Aidvantage. This means my Social Security number, financial aid history, loan balances, and repayment details may have been exposed to unauthorized parties. 

I became aware of this breach on the week of XX/XX/year>, when multiple news outlets confirmed that student loan records were improperly accessed : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX I have NOT authorized Aidvantage or the Department of Education to share , disclose, or compromise my student loan data. Since my records have been improperly accessed, putting my financial and personal security at risk, I am demanding immediate loan discharge as a remedy for this breach.

I request that the CFPB launch an investigation into Aidvantages handling of my personal data, enforce accountability for this breach, and require the Department of Education to provide immediate relief, including loan cancellation for affected borrowers. 

If this request is not promptly addressed, I will escalate this matter by filing additional complaints with the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), my State Attorney General, and my congressional representatives.

Requested Resolution : Immediate discharge of my student loans due to the unauthorized access and permanent compromise of my personal financial information.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally address a significant issue regarding the unauthorized consolidation of my federal student loan and its impact on my eligibility for the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) program. While I have no issue fulfilling my obligation to repay my loan, I am deeply concerned about the unauthorized actions taken by XXXX XXXX ( now MOHELA ) that have adversely affected my loan terms and PSLF progress. 

Specifically, my XXXX XXXX Loan in the amount of {$24000.00}, originated on XX/XX/XXXX XXXX was consolidated by XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX, without my consent or knowledge. There is no master promissory note or any documentation in existence that reflects my authorization for this consolidation. As a result of this action, the terms of my loan were altered, including an increase in the interest rate from 2.5 % to 3.5 %. Furthermore, the loan was transferred to a different account on XX/XX/XXXX, again without my approval or awareness. 

This unauthorized consolidation has caused significant harm, including the loss of qualifying payments toward XXXX. I have been making consistent payments under the XXXX program, which should have been counted as qualifying payments. However, due to the unjustified consolidation, these payments were not credited correctly. The only action I took in XX/XX/XXXX2017 was recertifying my income-driven repayment plan, which should not have triggered a consolidation or altered my loan disbursement date. 

Upon discovering this error in XX/XX/XXXX2018, I immediately contacted XXXX XXXX to resolve the issue. Unfortunately, I was informed that the consolidation could not be reversed, nor could my original disbursement date be restored. While XXXX XXXX offered to reduce the new interest rate by XXXX percentage point, this adjustment still left me with a higher rate than my original 2.5 %. Additionally, XXXX XXXX assured me that eligible payments would be credited toward XXXX. However, since the transfer of my loan to a new servicer, these commitments have not been honored. 

To date, I have not received any documentation, including a master promissory note or other supporting materials, that verifies my consent for the consolidation of my loan. This lack of documentation further underscores the unauthorized nature of this action.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally request validation of the debt that you claim I owe, as is my right under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), specifically 15 U.S.C. 1692g. I received your communication regarding this debt on [ date of initial contact ], and I am requesting written verification of the following details : 1. The amount of the debt, including a detailed breakdown of principal, interest, and any fees.

2. The name of the original creditor, along with documentation proving that this debt is valid and belongs to me.

3. Proof that your company is authorized to collect this debt, including a copy of the agreement that grants you the right to collect on behalf of the original creditor or proof of ownership if the debt was sold to your company. 

Please note that I am not refusing to pay but am requesting validation to ensure the accuracy of this debt. Until this validation is provided, I request that you : Cease all collection activities, including phone calls, letters, and reporting to credit bureaus. 
Refrain from sharing inaccurate or unverified information with any credit reporting agencies. 

If you are unable to provide the requested documentation, I request that you immediately remove any references to this debt from my credit report and confirm this in writing. 

Please respond to this request in writing within 30 days. If you fail to validate the debt as required under the FDCPA, I will explore all available remedies, including filing complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and my state attorney general, as well as seeking legal recourse if necessary. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
My school have interfered with distribution of my credit balance from XXXX and XXXX and retaliated against me for demanding payout of my credit balance of MY LOAN Balance. 
XXXX ISSUES First, ( in XXXX ) they prevented me from putting back a class that was acidentally dropped, ( unformalized understanding of online portal and lack of safe guards to prevent or confirm drop class confirmation options ). 
Second ( in XXXX ), They enrolled me in a Spanish class that required student to pay for access to a special application from a external vender, knowing I told them I was homeless, unemployed, and walking to school for lack of money. 
Third, ( In XXXX ), XXXX debt of - {$1500.00}, for the accidentally Dropped class, when it states full refund due to class was dropped timely. Then when I disbuted thier claim of why I owed, they changed it to I owed it for purchases from the school store, which is false, due to them taking, or should have taken it out of my active loan. 

XXXX The school continued their retaliation in my new school year XXXX by placing me on academic probation for not failing classes ( XXXXXXXX XXXX class ), I could not access due to lack of funds and homelessness, so this means I must obtain passing grades in all my XXXX classes, but my test records clearly shows I lack knowlege of many subject areas and require tutoring. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, I attended XXXX when I was much younger, so it's much harder for me then a younger student fresh out of high school, but yet they offer no senior tutoring programs. 

At present I am in a math class for XXXX semester, I currently am having problems understanding the work, I emailed my teacher for help, but her response was giving me until the XXXX of XXXX, but did not offer me any tutoring information or assistance, fully knowing I am on academic probation, this is because the retaillation continues. 
Now they will use the academic issue to hold up my credit balance distribution, again.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Immediate Action Needed : Approve Outstanding Borrower Defense Applications To the Departments Overseeing School & Loan Server Compliance, We are writing as a collective group of defrauded students and alumni who attended XXXX schools, urging immediate action to approve outstanding Borrower Defense applications and provide full relief for those impacted. 

Many of us attended the following institutions owned by or affiliated with XXXX, where misrepresentations and predatory practices have been well-documented : * XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX The Department of Education has already found significant evidence of misconduct by these schools. Specifically, XXXX XXXX  misrepresented job placement rates to prospective students between XXXX and XXXX, falsely claiming that 90 % of graduates secured jobs in their field of study within six months of graduation. This claim, widely advertised in national campaigns and direct mailings, was later revealed to be grossly inaccurate. XXXX included old jobs held by mid-career students before enrolling and excluded graduates who found employment outside their field of study. 

At its peak, XXXX enrolled nearly XXXX students across campuses in XXXX states and through an online program accessible nationwide. The scale of this deception has left countless students burdened with unmanageable debt and limited opportunities, as documented in the Department of Educations Borrower Defense Executive Summary and Statements of Facts.

We are asking you to take immediate steps to : 1. Approve all outstanding Borrower Defense applications for students who attended these institutions. 

XXXX. Discharge all loans associated with fraudulent practices, including consolidated loans. 

XXXX. Repair borrowers credit reports to reflect the removal of these fraudulent debts. 

Delaying action only prolongs the harm caused by these predatory institutions, leaving borrowers unable to move forward with their lives. Many of us pursued higher education to achieve the XXXX XXXX, but this dream was stolen by the very institutions we trusted to help us achieve it. 

We implore you to act decisively to ensure justice for all borrowers who were misled and exploited. The stakes are simply too high to risk further delays. 

Thank you for your attention to this urgent matter. 

Sincerely, Students & Graduates of XXXX XXXX

Issue: Dealing with your lender or servicer
Sub-issue: Received bad information about your loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX, my account was placed into forbearance due to being part of the SAVE program. I continued to make payments throughout, taking advantage of the 0 % interest rate. On XX/XX/XXXXXXXX  I had made a {$1400.00} payment towards my final loan that brought my total owed down to {$2100.00}. Under my loan details, that was the balance showed until XX/XX/XXXXXXXX  when I made a final payment in full of the {$2100.00}. Once that payment had cleared on XX/XX/XXXX, I showed a balance of {$0.00}. 

On the morning of XX/XX/XXXX I logged into the account to see if I had any notification of final payment or the loan being paid in full, and I noticed that I now owed a balance of {$17.00}. I used the chat function within the website, and was quickly greeted by a representative. She would check back in every few minutes to say she was researching my account, then ended the chat without answering any questions. I was able to get another representative ( XXXX ), and she informed me that my outstanding balance as of XX/XX/XXXXXXXX  was {$2200.00}. I told her that was not the information I was provided, and explained that just the day prior I showed a balance of {$0.00}. She said that she was sorry, but the only way for the account to be closed was to pay the {$17.00}. I ended the chat with her and called the direct line. 

Once on the phone, I notified the new representative that I would record the call for my records. She had told me the same thing as XXXX, but this time when I explained the situation further, she said she would talk with a team lead. After a brief hold, they were able to remedy the situation and re-XXXX  my account back out. They mentioned that there was a software glitch that caused payments to not be reported on their end. 

My concern is that if I would have just listened to the first two representatives, I would have had to pay the new balance due. It was not a large amount by any means, but {$17.00} spread out over millions of borrowers could result in MILLIONS stolen from customers at no fault of their own. I recommend any borrower do their due dilligence and maintain physical evidence of payments and balances owed upon every transaction.

Consumer complaint narrative:
My loan servicer is Mohela, and I am currently on the SAVE payment plan, and therefore, unable to make payments due to court injunctions that have resulted in me being placed in a general forbearance. On XX/XX/year>, I submitted an application to switch to another Income-Driven Repayment Plan via studentaid.gov, which was then transferred to my loan servicer, Mohela. Mohela confirmed via online correspondence in my inbox that they received my application on XX/XX/year>. 

Per federal guidance, " If you submit an application to enroll in an IDR plan other than SAVE, but your loan servicer is unable to process your application within 10 business days of receiving the application or before your next billing statement will be sent, you will be moved into a processing forbearance for up to 60 days. During this period, you do not have to make your monthly payments on your student loans, interest is accruing, and time spent does provide credit toward PSLF* and IDR When you are moved into forbearance, your loan servicer will notify you about which type of forbearance you are in and which previous months were covered by which type of forbearance. They will also notify you when you have been placed in a new IDR plan. '' It has now been 67 days since Mohela reports recieving my application, far beyond the 10 business days they had to process my application and move me to a Processing Forbearance. I have reached out twice to request that they move me to a processing forbearance. Not moving my loans into to this processing forebearance will result in financial costs to me, as I will have to " buy-back '' these months insead of recieving he PSLF credit that I am due if they follow federal guidance.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX, I noticed that my loan balance with Aidvantage had increased by {$100.00} without explanation. My previous Aidvantage statement from XX/XX/XXXX, showed a balance of {$27000.00}, but as of XX/XX/XXXX, my balance was listed as {$27000.00}. This increase is not reflected in my official XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) records. 

I contacted Aidvantage via their online messaging system to request a detailed breakdown of this balance adjustment, including an explanation of whether this was an interest charge, adjustment, or error. Aidvantage has not yet provided an adequate response or clear documentation proving this charge was valid. 

This unexplained increase raises concerns about potential mismanagement or errors in Aidvantages loan servicing. I am requesting an official investigation into this matter to ensure that Aidvantage is accurately reporting loan balances and not making unauthorized adjustments. Additionally, I request that Aidvantage provide a full and transparent explanation of this {$100.00} increase and correct my balance if this charge was applied in error.

If Aidvantage fails to provide a valid explanation or adjust my balance accordingly, I am prepared to escalate this matter further to the Federal Student Aid Ombudsman and the Department of Educations Office of Inspector General.

Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom It May Concern, I am filing this complaint against my federal student loan servicer, Mohela, due to issues involving the accuracy of my loan status and unacceptable customer service interactions.

1. Inaccurate Loan Status I have verified with StudentAid.gov that my loans are in forbearance, yet Mohelas records fail to reflect this. This discrepancy creates confusion and potential harm, including the risk of incorrect reporting to credit agencies. 

2. Unprofessional Customer Service When I contacted Mohela on [ insert date ], a representative stated, I dont care in response to my concern. Additionally, after requesting to escalate the matter to a manager, I received a callback from someone who was not a manager, which prevented proper resolution of my issue.

Impact on Me as a Borrower : Emotional stress from the servicers unprofessional behavior.

Risk of financial harm due to incorrect loan status and potential credit reporting errors.

Actions I Am Seeking : Immediate correction of my loan status to accurately reflect the verified forbearance. 
Written assurance that no adverse credit reporting or financial penalties have occurred as a result of Mohelas error.

Investigation into Mohelas customer service practices to ensure fair treatment of borrowers.

I request the CFPB to investigate this matter and hold Mohela accountable for providing accurate information and professional service. 

Personal Information for Reference : Name : XXXX XXXX Loan Account Number : XXXX Contact Information : XXXX, XXXX Thank you for your assistance in addressing this issue. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX I called studentaid.gov to verify that my XXXX XXXX application is in review and submitted as of XX/XX/XXXX. XXXX XXXX did very and stated that I was not supposed to be in a payment status since the application takes 3 years to review so I am automatically in a Forbearance. 
XX/XX/XXXX I called Mohela-the wait time was XXXX and a half hours. I left a message and did not receive a call back. 

XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX I called Mohela- I waited on the line for XXXX for a representative which I had a conversation with XXXX who is ( in the beginner que ). I asked questions about my loan and she stated " I dont care '' I asked to speak with a supervisor and she transferred me back in the que. I was on the phone for XXXX min. 

XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX XXXX XXXX Not a manager called me back, gave me info on the process to speak with a supervisor. Went over basic information with me and stated my loan is not in a forbearance and I can apply for that which she could help e with and then the line got disconnect. 

XX/XX/XXXX called Mohela again and requested call back at XXXX hr wait time. I left a message and a trying to speak with a supervisor. I have the previous call recorded for XXXX and will continue to record the calls for my protection. 

I just need to validate my status so I do not receive over due notices which is currently reporting on my credit. Also I am requesting for the Master Promissory note which is not listed on the Student Aid.gov website. 

My main goal was to make sure I am not in a repayment status. This is not right and violates my rights as a consumer with Mohela of which I never had a formal or professional agreement with them in the first place. 

Rights violated : Right to Accurate Loan Information Right to Proper Customer Service Right to Fair Treatment Right to Escalation and Complaint Resolution Right to Forbearance if Approved- my Forbearance is approved and reflected currently on XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
I have federal student loans with Mohela as my servicer. Mohela has consistently avoided responding to my emails and has refused to processed my income driven repayment application in a timely manner. 

XXXX. In XX/XX/XXXX, I consolidated my loans with the intention to enroll in the SAVE IDR plan. However, court litigation prevented my enrollment and I requested with Mohela to be placed into a processing forbearance. Mohela put me in a forbearance but did not specify if it was a processing forbearance and my loans continued to accrue interest due to this. I also did not earn XXXX credit which was the reason why I wanted to stay in the processing forbearance. Then, I tried to switch into the XXXX XXXX plan in XX/XX/XXXX so I could start making payments on my loan and also accrue credit for XXXX. 

XXXX. I called Mohela on XX/XX/XXXX to switch into the XXXX plan and the XXXX customer service representative, XXXX ID : XXXX, told me that I would need to wait for the processing to be complete. In the meantime, I would be removed from forbearance so my application could be processed in a timely manner. I emailed Mohela on XX/XX/XXXX requesting that I have this information provided to me in writing and to process my application soon since I had an upcoming payment, but they have not responded to my emails as of XX/XX/XXXX ( 11 days from initial email ). Since I was removed from SAVE forbearance, they have me on the standard repayment plan now with a monthly payment I can not afford and it is due XX/XX/XXXX. I absolutely need to be on an IDR plan otherwise I can not afford to start repaying my loans. Mohela has been extraordinarily unhelpful through this process, in that they have not emailed me back AND they put me on hold whenever I call for nearly XXXX hours at a time.
