Consumer complaint narrative:
MOHELA has been the servicer for my wife and myself and out Direct consolidated loans that were consolidated back in XXXX. We attended an out of state University XXXX and graduated with XXXX XXXX and huge student debt as a result of the fact that the University refused to consider us as in state residents as had originally been promised- out of state tuition was at least XXXX times that of instate but we had no choice. 

We have been working toward PSLF ( public service loan forgiveness- work in non profit public service qualifying job and make XXXX consecutive payments ) since the very beginning- I had my first application denied in late XXXX XX/XX/XXXX was the beginning of the program- we were in the very first batch of PSLF applications able to be reviewed. As is widely known as fact- Like XXXX % applicants were were declined due to this or that rule. There was XXXX  oversight or guidance over this XXXX XXXX month stretch. We made payment after payment in consolidated loans ranging from {$400.00} early on- to {$520.00} a month as the payments were income contingent. We never missed a beat. We were making $ XXXX a year when we started repayment. Our entire careers have been fixated on PSLF as a result we have been in non profit sector jobs since XXXX our earning potential has been truncated by this program and our pursuit of it. 

With the Biden administrations focus on student loans- the enacting of TEPSLF Temporary expanded ) We reapplied- and as of late XXXX our then servicer XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX of XXXX on our balance. This represented my portion of the balance even though XXXX XXXX and I had taken out exactly the same amount. We did not find out and were not told until XXXX that XXXX XXXX also had to submit XXXX applications- and that this was the remaining balance now XXXX $ XXXX. She completed the required forms, jumped the hoops ( not an issue as she had put in the time ) and we were told every single time we called in XXXX by MOHELA that " all looks good, just keep waiting. It's in FSA 's hands now ( Federal Student Aid ) ". We regularly received conflicting information we were placed on endless holds, our calls were dropped. 

We received a forgiveness letter from FSA on XX/XX/XXXX indicating that the remainder of our loans ( $ XXXX ) were to be forgiven- the letter states that they await MOHELA to process this and discharge our loans. MOHELA have said that it " XXXX not in their hands " Any day now, just keep waiting for FSA- ''. Since that letter ( correspondence I had to submit to MOHELA myself and they denied for XXXX weeks they even had ) we have had to call MOHELA every other month to extend forbearance until such time whomever or however they decide to XXXX  the balance and we are deemed free form the predatory clutches of MOHELA. Nothing has happened since XX/XX/XXXX and I have thought for months something must be askew. 

TO THE FINAL STRAW and reason for me seeking you : We called XX/XX/XXXX as our forbearance was set to end again XXXX we waited on hold XXXX hours and were curtly told that " there's nothing we can do you are in forbearance until XXXX call back closer to your loan due date and we will reinstitute the forbearance '' ( XX/XX/XXXX ). 

We called yesterday XX/XX/XXXX and held for XXXX hours combined. The only time we actually spoke with a live person after holding XXXX hours- ( XXXX XXXXouldn't help usXXXX didn't have the 'access ' she needed to fulfill our request then had to transfer our call ) phone disconnected after XXXX minutes on their end- they disconnected the call- We called back at XXXX XXXX held XXXX more hours- no answer. No option to put in call back request- slave to sitting waiting for the hold to end and speak to a live person. Didn't happen. We hung up at XXXX as we actually have lives. 

We called again this morning XX/XX/XXXX right before XXXX held for XXXX hours- we were told by MOHELA XXXX you have no more forbearance to be applied- you have a payment due XX/XX/XXXX. '' They stated forbearance was " up to FSA you need to call them about it we cant do anything- you have a payment due XX/XX/XXXX. '' We plead for more info- got placed on hold at least XXXX  times during which they stated " I'm conferring with my mentor and asking how to proceed ''. She finally came back on- bottom lined that " it's not in their hands and we have a payment due XX/XX/XXXX. '' We asked that she put us to a supervisor- she FLAT OUT STATED NO " You need to call FSA ''. She refused to transfer the call. We asked again to be transferred- she again declined. 

We then called FSA about XXXX XXXX got someone quickly who transferred us to a specialist- she was informative and basically stated that based on the real time information they could see that MOHELA did not have XXXX XXXX in their system and was not correctly reflecting the status of our loans in the registry/ database as they had been joint consolidation loans- they only reflected my info- that her PSFL application essentially had been dropped in XXXX and that this has to be the issue as to why the loans have not been XXXX % discharged. We were told by FSA to call MOHELA back- inform them of their error- to update their records to accurately reflect XXXX XXXX in the registry. Called MOHELA back at XXXX We have been on hold since - XXXX XXXX and I are both on what is stated to be a " hold time XXXX hours ''. They will not pick up. 

They are using this loophole that they are fully aware of to block our loan being discharged, they simply want our money. They are doing whatever and whenever to put us off. 

XXXX XXXX shows XXXX loans in XXXXSA and as such our process to get her PSLF application and Employee certification forms back in place can not be done on her dashboard ( " you have no loans that qualify for PLSF '' ). We have since prepared the ECFs for her current qualifying employer with whom she has been since XXXX full time XXXX hour a week. Also have XXXX for her other employer ( also a qualifying XXXX where she was XXXX ). I also contend that the employer she was with from XXXX XX/XX/XXXX qualifies but we have had little luck as they have changed hands a few times. 

Here 's a little kicker : As a result of our overpayment ( anything paid over the XXXX qualifying ) we are owed a refund : it's roughly {$15000.00}. 

Bottom line- she meets the requirements for PSLF as I did- we had the same employers ( except for XXXX comprising XXXX  months which still is a qualifying XXXX ) MOHELA dropped the ball amidst the transfer or somewhere along the way and as a result we have to pay them until this gets sorted or we will take a credit hit. 

Per the XX/XX/XXXX court case XXXX v. MOHELA- this is the regular practice of theirs- they deceive, deflect and derail a loan holders attempts to have their loans discharged. Mohela have had multiple other issues and the Federal government took away their contract for PSLF for a period as they had made such a mess of it. Lets be clear- we have MORE than paid the amount we borrowed as from XXXX XXXX None of those loan payments counted toward PSLF. In XXXX before we hard of PSLF we were resigned to pay on XXXX years of loans. PSLF gave us hope we'd be able to get out form under in XXXX years- and then possibly pursue higher paying jobs in the private sector or different careers altogether- XXXX theme was clear- keep your head down for XXXX  years- pay the monthly payment. We did this. PSLF is a government created program- we arent asking for handouts or crying for something we haven't earned or been explicitly promised. If I had entered private sector work in XXXX when I was supposed to be originally forgiven- I'd be making twice as much as I do now. 

We need ASSISTANCE : someone to intervene and hold this repeat offender and their ongoing willful deflection, misinformation and incompetence that are tantamount to criminal business practices- I am considering taking legal action vs MOHELA. They have caused us immeasurable anxiety and they have greatly truncated our finances. 

-Incessant hold times ( XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX combined going on XXXX hours ) -Misinformation -Call deflection -Blatant lies If we are enduring this- thousands of others are. This has been haunting us for XXXX  months since we were first declined in XX/XX/XXXX. We stand at the finish line- we now have a son in college ( guess who didn't qualify for financial aid because his dad showed $ XXXX in outstanding student loans? ) - MOHELA are the only barrier between us being done with this page of our lives. They are a horrible company ad they prey on people. This needs to stop. 

Thank you.
Company public response: Company believes it acted appropriately as authorized by contract or law

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am currently in the SAVE Plan Forbearance and have been since it was announced. During this time, interest is not supposed to be accruing on the loan balance. I have had interest accruing this entire time and my balance has increased by thousands. 

I believe I have had interest accruing even before this latest round of forbearance, as it has all been insanely confusing the last few years as a student loan borrower. There have been multiple types of forbearance I have been automatically been in, removed from, etc. There has been so much conflicting information on payments, repayments, etc. It is all incredibly frustrating and I believe my balance and accounts are being mishandled against current policy. 

I have attached screenshots that show the balance from XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX where the balance has increased. Note the XXXX balance as XXXX  lower. This all occurred after the SAVE interest halt was announced. These screenshots come from both studentaid.gov and MOHELA. 

Note the MOHELA info shows the interest all at 0 %, yet the balance is increased. 

I have tried to contact MOHELA multiple times but never get through. 

This whole process has felt abusive, cruel, and confusing as a student aid borrower.

Body:MOHELA's Response:
Dear ________,
Please accept our sincere apologies for the long hold times. We value your feedback, as we understand how important it is to offer exceptional service. We have experienced significantly heightened demand recently, and we understand that this has made it difficult to connect with our specialists to discuss your concerns. We are working diligently to provide an improved experience for all student loan borrowers moving forward.

The most recent payment has been reversed from the account. Please be advised your financial institution returned your payment effective XXXX XXXX XXXX , in the amount of XXXX. The payment has been reversed from your account for the following reason and your account may now be delinquent: NO ACCOUNT / UNABLE TO LOCATE. We recommend reviewing the payment information that was entered. This error message is not to be confused with an insufficient funds message indicating that there is not enough funds in the account for payment. The unable to locate error means we were not able to locate your financial institution.

The last payment(s) of XXXX was received on XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX. Your next payment of XXXX will be due on XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, the U.S. Department of Education (ED) announced several changes and updates that will bring borrowers closer to forgiveness under income-driven repayment (IDR) plans. These adjustments to accounts include conducting a one-time revision of IDR payment counters to address past inaccuracies and permanently fix IDR payment counting by reforming EDs IDR tracking procedures going forward.
 
Based on the newly eligible months from the one-time account adjustment, borrowers who have reached 240 or 300 months (as applicable) worth of payments for IDR forgiveness or 120 months of PSLF will begin to see their loans forgiven in XXXX. The Department will continue to discharge loans as borrowers reach the months needed for forgiveness. All other borrowers will see their accounts update in XXXX.

More information on these upcoming changes is available at: https://studentaid.gov/announcements-events/idr-account-adjustment.
 
If you have any other questions or concerns, please contact us at the number listed below.
 
Sincerely,
 XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX    Secure Form Submission This message, from a debt collector, is an attempt to collect a debt and any information obtained will be used for that purpose.XXXX XXXX If you are struggling with your student loans, please fill out the form located at: XXXXXXXXt to get help from the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX: The state Rosenthal Fair Debt Collection Practices Act and the federal Fair Debt Collection Practices Act require that, except under unusual circumstances, collectors may not contact you before 8 a.m. or after 9 p.m.  They may not harass you by using threats of violence or arrest or by using obscene language.  Collectors may not use false or misleading statements or call you at work if they know or have reason to know that you may not receive personal calls at work.  For the most part, collectors may not tell another person, other than your attorney or spouse, about your debt.  Collectors may contact another person to confirm your location or enforce a judgment.  For more information about debt collection activities, you may contact the Federal Trade Commission at XXXX  or www.ftc.gov. XXXX  I received a letter from MOHELA stating:
Your student loans are in a forbearance. On XXXX XXXX XXXX, a federal court issued a stay preventing the Department of Education (ED)from operating the Saving on a Valuable Education (SAVE) Plan. As a result of this ruling, ED has directed MOHELA to put your account into a forbearance. You can find more information at StudentAid.gov/saveaction.


What does this mean for me?
While you are in this forbearance no payment is required on your account and your interest rate will be set to 0%. This means no interest will accrue while you are in the
Forbearance. You will not receive credit toward IDR forgiveness and Public Service Loan Forgiveness (PSLF) for the month(s) covered by the forbearance. If you made or make a payment for the month(s) you are in the forbearance, the amounts paid will go toward satisfying your future payment(s). We will notify you before the forbearance comes to an end. We do not currently have a time estimate. We will then send you your next monthly billing statement at least 21 days before your next monthly payment is due
At this point I was ill. After all the issues I went through to get my payments set up to now not being able to pay them.. So incredibly infuriating. They are my loans and Ive been enrolled in PSLF for years! I should be able to continue paying under the PSLF qualifying plan! 


XXXX  I contacted MOHELA again, because it had been 4 months since I was put on administrative forbearance after FINALLY getting my payment plan ready to go with the new SAVE plan:  
FROM MOHELA:
Thank you for contacting MOHELA,
Although the General Forbearance for borrowers enrolled in SAVE does not count toward PSLF, there are currently two ways borrowers may be able to receive PSLF credit. Borrowers should review these two options closely before taking any action.
1) Buy Back Credit: Some borrowers may be eligible to buy back months of PSLF credit for time spent in forbearance as a result of the courts injunction. Borrowers with 120 months of eligible employment can buy back (make payments to cover) past months that were not counted as qualifying payments because the borrower was in an ineligible deferment or forbearance status. Borrowers must submit a buyback request and make an extra payment of at least as much as what they would have owed under an income-driven repayment (IDR) plan during the months they are trying to buy back.
Borrowers can buy back these months only if:
- they still have an outstanding balance on their loan(s),
- they have approved qualifying employment for these same months, and
- buying back these months will complete their total of 120 qualifying PSLF payments.


This is a new process that ED began making available XXXX XXXXXXXX Learn about eligibility and how to buy back months by visiting XXXXXXXX Note: Borrowers who have consolidation loans can buy back months only on the current consolidation loan. These borrowers cant buy back months from the loans included in the consolidation loan or for any period prior to the first disbursement date of a consolidation loan.


2) Enroll in a different PSLF-eligible repayment plan: Borrowers can apply to enroll in a different PSLF-eligible repayment plan. We encourage borrowers to look at the specific terms of each plan to make the best choice for their individual situation. See above for more information. Different IDR plans may require higher monthly payments than the SAVE Plan does, andin the case of some IDR plansborrowers who later leave them may face interest capitalization (where unpaid interest is added to the principal balance). However, payments made under these IDR plans will count toward forgiveness under IDR and PSLF.Borrowers should expect a lengthy delay in the processing of applications. Further communication will be provided as this develops.


Additional details pertaining to the impacts of this stay will be provided as they become available. You may also visit XXXXXXXX and XXXXXXXX for updates.


If you have any additional questions, please contact us toll free at XXXX. Our hours are XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX.


Thank you,
MOHELA

I went online to review the latest letter from MOHELA and read about my options. 
I cannot switch to a different qualifying PSLF payment plan because MOHELA and federal student aid states that switching would result in a processing forbearance - so this would put me in the same exact position I am currently in, therefore, its not an option. All information that Ive been given over the years from Mohela representatives via phone or through the website/my messaging about repaying MY OWN student loans is inaccurate or the information is only correct/valid for a few months before it changes again. The ever-changing agreements to my loans and repayment and PSLF causes me an immense amount of stress. It is impacting my mental health and the stress and confusion makes me physically ill. I have to take time off of work XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX) to call MOHELA because the wait times are so long. 


All the months of administrative forbearance I have been placed on while on the SAVE plan should count towards my PSLF qualifying payments, please switch them from ineligible to eligible. From XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, and moving forward, all months that I am still on administrative forbearance should count towards my PSLF qualifying months, too. Since there is no other plan I can apply to without being placed in another processing forbearance (for an unknown amount of time) this is the only fair resolution. Once the above resolutions are in place, I would also like to receive loan terms and PSLF terms that state how many more qualifying payments I need to make to qualify for the final PSLF forgiveness. I would also like to request a date of when my payments of XXXX  will resume.

Messages : I have left several messages requesting assistance but have not received any responses.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Immediate Action Needed : Approve Outstanding Borrower Defense Applications To the Departments Overseeing School & Loan Server Compliance, We are writing as a collective group of defrauded students and alumni who attended XXXXaffiliated schools, urging immediate action to approve outstanding Borrower Defense applications and provide full relief for those impacted. 

Many of us attended the following institutions owned by or affiliated with XXXX, where misrepresentations and predatory practices have been well-documented : * XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX The Department of Education has already found significant evidence of misconduct by these schools. Specifically, XXXX University misrepresented job placement rates to prospective students between XXXX and XXXX, falsely claiming that 90 % of graduates secured jobs in their field of study within XXXX months of graduation. This claim, widely advertised in national campaigns and direct mailings, was later revealed to be grossly inaccurate. XXXX included old jobs held by mid-career students before enrolling and excluded graduates who found employment outside their field of study. 

At its peak, XXXX enrolled nearly XXXX students across campuses in XXXX states and through an online program accessible nationwide. The scale of this deception has left countless students burdened with unmanageable debt and limited opportunities, as documented in the Department of Educations Borrower Defense Executive Summary and Statements of Facts.

We are asking you to take immediate steps to : 1. Approve all outstanding Borrower Defense applications for students who attended these institutions.

2. Discharge all loans associated with fraudulent practices, including consolidated loans.

3. Repair borrowers credit reports to reflect the removal of these fraudulent debts.

Delaying action only prolongs the harm caused by these predatory institutions, leaving borrowers unable to move forward with their lives. Many of us pursued higher education to achieve the American Dream, but this dream was stolen by the very institutions we trusted to help us achieve it.

We implore you to act decisively to ensure justice for all borrowers who were misled and exploited. The stakes are simply too high to risk further delays. 

Thank you for your attention to this urgent matter. 

Sincerely, Students & Graduates of XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am submitting this formal complaint regarding a violation of my rights under the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act ( FERPA ) ( 20 U.S.C. 1232g ; 34 CFR Part 99 ) due to unauthorized access to my Federal Student Aid ( FSA ) records. 

Key Details : Date of violation : XX/XX/year> Entity responsible : Federal Student Aid ( FSA ), U.S. Department of Education Issue : Unauthorized access to my personal and financial records without my consent Actions I took : Submitted a formal complaint to the Department of Educations Student Privacy FERPA Office Notified my loan servicer about the unauthorized access Filed a report with Federal Student Aid ( FSA ) to document the potential breach Description of Violation : On XX/XX/year>, I discovered that my student loan records within the Federal Student Aid ( FSA ) system were accessed without my authorization. Under FERPA regulations, FSA is legally required to protect the privacy of student records and restrict access to authorized personnel only. 

If my personally identifiable information ( PII ) including my loan balance, repayment terms, and financial detailswas viewed, shared, or modified without my explicit consent, this constitutes a direct violation of federal law and exposes me to identity theft, fraud, and financial risk. 

Despite my efforts to report this issue and seek clarity, I have not received a satisfactory explanation from FSA regarding : Who accessed my records Why the access occurred What specific information was viewed or modified Impact of the Violation : This breach has caused significant privacy concerns, including : Potential misuse or unauthorized modification of my student loan account.

Loss of trust in FSAs ability to secure borrower data.

Emotional distress due to the mishandling of my private financial information.

Requested Resolution : I request that FSA and the appropriate federal agencies take immediate action to : Conduct a formal investigation into the unauthorized access of my records. 
Provide a written report confirming whether my data was accessed, altered, or disclosed. 
Enhance security measures to prevent future FERPA violations. 
Notify all affected borrowers if their student loan data was improperly accessed. 
Offer compensation or corrective measures if this violation caused financial harm. 
Formal Request for Response : I request a written response within 30 days detailing : The findings of your internal investigation into this breach. 
The corrective actions being implemented to secure borrower data. 
Whether affected borrowers, including myself, will receive compensation or debt relief due to this failure to protect student loan records. 
Failure to properly address this matter may result in additional formal complaints being filed with : The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) The Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) The U.S. Department of Justice ( DOJ ) Legal counsel specializing in data privacy violations Conclusion : Federal Student Aid ( FSA ) has a legal and ethical obligation to protect borrower records and comply with FERPA. If my student loan records were improperly accessed, FSA must be held accountable and take immediate corrective action to ensure borrower data security. 

I expect urgent attention on this matter and request an immediate investigation and resolution.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to file a formal complaint against Navient for what I believe are deceptive practices regarding the management of my student loan account, specifically related to the application of deferments. 

Navient repeatedly placed my account in deferment status without my clear understanding or informed consent. While they sent emails requesting that I reply " yes '' to approve the forbarance, at no point did I have a voice-to-voice conversation with a representative to fully explain the implications. This lack of communication and transparency is deeply concerning. 

Furthermore, XXXX practices appear to lack adequate safeguards to prevent repeated and automatic deferments amd forbarance. These forbearances caused my loan balance, which initially was manageable, to grow substantially over time. This outcome has placed an undue financial burden on me, as I was not made fully aware of how these deferments would affect the overall loan balance and XXXX would auto place me on a forbearance. 

Navient 's actions seem to exploit borrowers who XXXX not fully understand the long-term consequences of deferments. I firmly believe there should have been stronger checks and balances in place to prevent this situation, such as freezing the account or requiring direct consultation with a borrower before applying consecutive deferments. 

I respectfully request that your agency investigate XXXX practices regarding deferments to ensure that other borrowers are not subjected to similar predatory practices. Additionally, I would appreciate guidance on any available recourse for the financial harm I have experienced. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXX, MD XXXX XXXX/XXXX/1025 Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, IA XXXX Subject : Complaint Regarding Inaccurate Credit Reporting Following Loan Forgiveness Dear CFPB Representative, I am writing to file a formal complaint regarding inaccurate information on my credit reports maintained by XXXX, XXXX, and TransUnion. Despite providing all three credit bureaus with documentation that my loans were forgiven, this information has not been accurately reflected on my credit reports, negatively impacting my credit score. 

I have contacted the credit bureaus directly, submitted a dispute with supporting documentation, and allowed the legally required 30-day period for an investigation and correction under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). However, my reports still show the incorrect loan status, which is not only inaccurate but also a violation of my consumer rights under the FCRA. 

The inaccurate reporting is causing significant harm to my financial well-being, including but not limited to : Lowering my credit score. 
Hindering my access to fair credit opportunities. 
Causing undue stress and financial instability. 

I am requesting the CFPB to intervene and assist in ensuring that my credit reports are promptly updated to reflect the correct informationspecifically, that the forgiven loans show a {$0.00} balance or are removed as appropriate. I am also seeking confirmation of the corrective actions taken by the credit bureaus and the creditors involved. 

Enclosed are copies of : The loan forgiveness documentation. 
Correspondence with the credit bureaus. 
Dispute submissions and responses received ( if any ). 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to a swift resolution to correct my credit reports and protect my consumer rights. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX [ Phone Number : XXXX ] XXXX XXXX
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Sub-issue: Problem with customer service
Consumer complaint narrative:
I have tried on two separate occasions to correct an issue with the deferment of my loans. I am in the middle of my 4 year program and should have " In School '' deferment until I graduate with an addition 6 month grace period after that. As of right now, each loan has a vastly different deferment end date, loan repayment start date and loan end date. 

I first called MOHELA on XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX XXXX  MT, and after navigating the the automated answering service I selected to receive a call back. I was told that it would take roughly 2 hours for me to receive a call back. They ended up calling me back at XXXX XXXX  MT, the phone rang exactly one time and the call was immediately terminated at the end of that ring. I ended up calling back at XXXX XXXX MT to get back in the cue to speak to an agent. I once again selected to receive a call back, this time I was told that the wait would be over 2 hours. I finally received a call back at XXXX XXXX  MT, I explained my situation to the agent, they agreed that the issue was on their end and that the " In School '' deferment dates should line up for each of my loans. I was then told that this situation couldn't be solved by them and that my call would need to be directed to a Supervisor of some kind. I was once again put on hold and I remained on hold until well after XXXX XXXX  MT ( XXXX XXXX  CT ) which is when they close their office. So I was on hold for 5 and 1/2 hours that day only to be ignored until they closed. 

My second attempt at rectifying this situation was on XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX XXXX  MT. I once again navigated the automated answering service and was told that I would receive a call back in about 1 and 1/2 hours. I received a call back at XXXX XXXX MT explained my case to another Agent who once again agreed that the " In School '' deferment dates should all align and that a Supervisor would be need to solve my problem. I was told that I would need to be on hold for another 4 hours. Midway through the hold I was informed that an error occurred and that my call would need to be restarted. 2 Hours after that I was once again speaking with a new agent that was unable to solve my problem. They placed me on yet another hold to wait for a Supervisor to become available. At about XXXX XXXX  MT I was once again informed that an error occurred and that I would need to restart my call again. 

I elected to not call back again today because I knew that the MOHELA office was to close in another 30 minutes, not giving me enough time to solve the issue. All said and done I was on hold/waiting for a return call for 8 hours. This is completely unacceptable, especially when considering that I am calling to have a mistake that MOHELA made corrected. I do not know how a business can conduct itself in such a manner when the work they're dealing in can drastically effect the financial wellbeing of their clients. 

I have sent a direct message to MOHELA, and emailed their Director of Business Development & Government Relations, Federal Contract and Program Senior Manager and their CEO and have yet to hear back as of typing this complaint.
Company public response: Company believes it acted appropriately as authorized by contract or law

All three credit reporting agencies need to be contacted and told this debt is paid in full nothing else will be satisfactory. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX Mohela ( XXXX ) XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Immediate Action Needed : Approve Outstanding Borrower Defense Applications To the Departments Overseeing School & Loan Server Compliance, We are writing as a collective group of defrauded students and alumni who attended XXXXaffiliated schools, urging immediate action to approve outstanding Borrower Defense applications and provide full relief for those impacted. 
Many of us attended the following institutions owned by or affiliated with XXXX, where misrepresentations and predatory practices have been well-documented : American University of XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX University XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX University XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX University XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX University School of Medicine The Department of Education has already found significant evidence of misconduct by these schools. Specifically, XXXX University misrepresented job placement rates to prospective students between XXXX and XXXX, falsely claiming that 90 % of graduates secured jobs in their field of study within XXXX months of graduation. This claim, widely advertised in national campaigns and direct mailings, was later revealed to be grossly inaccurate. XXXX included old jobs held by mid-career students before enrolling and excluded graduates who found employment outside their field of study. 
At its peak, XXXX enrolled nearly XXXX students across campuses in XXXX states and through an online program accessible nationwide. The scale of this deception has left countless students burdened with unmanageable debt and limited opportunities, as documented in the Department of Educations Borrower Defense Executive Summary and Statements of Facts. 
We are asking you to take immediate steps to : Approve all outstanding Borrower Defense applications for students who attended these institutions. 
Discharge all loans associated with fraudulent practices, including consolidated loans. 
Repair borrowers credit reports to reflect the removal of these fraudulent debts. 
Delaying action only prolongs the harm caused by these predatory institutions, leaving borrowers unable to move forward with their lives. Many of us pursued higher education to achieve the American Dream, but this dream was stolen by the very institutions we trusted to help us achieve it. 
We implore you to act decisively to ensure justice for all borrowers who were misled and exploited. The stakes are simply too high to risk further delays. 
Thank you for your attention to this urgent matter. 
Sincerely, Students & Graduates of XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
This letter is concerning the Department of Educations recent decision to provide student loan information illegally to a non-authorized third party group, the Department of Government Efficiency.

The U.S. Federal Government computer system is allowed solely to be accessed by individual users expressly authorized to access the system by the U.S. Department of Education. Unauthorized use of this information system is prohibited and subject to criminal and civil penalties under 18 U.S.C. 1030 and other applicable statutes. My personal and financial information was shared with an unelected and non-congressionally approved entity without my authorization.

The Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act ( FERPA ) additionally protects the confidentiality of student records. This breach is a clear violation of FERPA and the Department of Educations responsibility to safeguard my information. Plain and simple, my consent was not obtained to access my financial information. 

Given the severity of the breach and the resulting compromise of my personal and financial information, I request that you immediately cancel and discharge my student loan balance in full. If I can provide any further information, please do not hesitate to contact me directly.
Company: Servicer under contract with Federal Student Aid

Consumer complaint narrative: I am writing to express my concern regarding the excessive interest charges on my XXXX loan. Upon reviewing my payment history and loan agreement, I noticed that I have paid more than XXXX times the original loan ( $ XXXX ) amount in interest alone ( $ XXXX ). This situation feels unreasonable and financially burdensome. While I understand the terms of the loan were agreed upon initially, the extent of the interest far exceeds what I believe to be fair or competitive compared to other lending options. It is disheartening to see that such terms heavily penalize borrowers and make it exceedingly difficult to pay off the principal amount. Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response. Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
Hi, my name is XXXX XXXX. I dont know who to reach out to for help. I am in Kentucky. 
I have school loans through MOHELA. My payment was XXXX a month in 2024 which was ok for me to pay. But in XXXX or XXXX they resent me a bill showing my payment would be almost XXXX a month. That I had 10 days to respond to ask for a lower payment. So I did. I tried contacting them starting in XXXX I redid the loan request to lower my payment. I never received another bill since. Then all of the sudden in XXXX I get a notification that I have a late payment that was due XX/XX/XXXX. In the amount of almost XXXX a month again, and now when I call their automated site says I owe XXXX XX/XX/XXXX. I called them again and I am told I will be on hold for 3 hr and something. So I selected to have them call me back. They called me back yesterday finally. And Ive been trying to reach them since XXXX. I talk to XXXX and after explaining to her what is going on she tells me she needs to transfer me to one of their advanced workers and then I am given the message it will be a hold of 5 hr and 25 minutes and the process stated all over again. 

Now my credit is going to be ruined for late school payments that I can not afford. Because the payment is higher than my mortgage payment. 

Please tell me who I can call if you are not able to help me. I have no where else to turn. This has been going on for over 3 months. Thank you in advance

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Immediate Action Needed : Approve Outstanding Borrower Defense Applications To the Departments Overseeing School & Loan Server Compliance, We are writing as a collective group of defrauded students and alumni who attended XXXX schools, urging immediate action to approve outstanding Borrower Defense applications and provide full relief for those impacted.

Many of us attended the following institutions owned by or affiliated with XXXX, where misrepresentations and predatory practices have been well-documented : * XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  The Department of Education has already found significant evidence of misconduct by these schools. Specifically, XXXX University misrepresented job placement rates to prospective students between XXXX and XXXX, falsely claiming that 90 % of graduates secured jobs in their field of study within XXXX months of graduation. This claim, widely advertised in national campaigns and direct mailings, was later revealed to be grossly inaccurate. XXXX included old jobs held by mid-career students before enrolling and excluded graduates who found employment outside their field of study. 

At its peak, XXXX enrolled nearly XXXX students across campuses in XXXX states and through an online program accessible nationwide. The scale of this deception has left countless students burdened with unmanageable debt and limited opportunities, as documented in the Department of Educations Borrower Defense Executive Summary and Statements of Facts.

We are asking you to take immediate steps to : 1. Approve all outstanding Borrower Defense applications for students who attended these institutions.

2. Discharge all loans associated with fraudulent practices, including consolidated loans.

3. Repair borrowers credit reports to reflect the removal of these fraudulent debts. 

Delaying action only prolongs the harm caused by these predatory institutions, leaving borrowers unable to move forward with their lives. Many of us pursued higher education to achieve the XXXX XXXX, but this dream was stolen by the very institutions we trusted to help us achieve it. 

We implore you to act decisively to ensure justice for all borrowers who were misled and exploited. The stakes are simply too high to risk further delays. 

Thank you for your attention to this urgent matter. 

Sincerely, Students & Graduates of XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX, I attempted to make a payment of {$270.00} in complete satisfaction of my loan. Without notice, Mohela reversed this payment. On XX/XX/XXXX, I attempted to make a payment of {$270.00}, representing the payment amount plus interest allowed to accrue as a result of the payment reversal. When I submitted this payment, I made sure to check that I received a message confirming my payment. I was shown a screen that said " payment successful. '' Two days later, on XX/XX/XXXX, I logged in to check on the status of my payment and saw that the status was payment accepted- I'm confident in the date and verbiage because I texted my spouse as soon as I saw this message, expressing joy to be done dealing with Mohela. However, and once again without notice, Mohela reversed this payment, backdating the transaction to XX/XX/XXXX despite having displayed the payment as accepted as late as XX/XX/XXXX. I sent the following message to Mohela on XX/XX/XXXX, when I logged in once again to confirm that Mohela hadn't created an issue with this payment. Mohela has not responded. 


I'm writing to request information regarding two " reversed '' payments, reversed without notice or explanation, resulting in additional interest accural. This is especially concerning given that when I logged in yesterday to check the status of my most recent attempt to pay, the payment was posted as " accepted ''. I additionally have a screenshot showing " Payment Successful '' from XXXX.

Consumer complaint narrative:
In light of the numerous attempts to enroll in an income based repayment program for which I have submitted numerous times. Shouldnt my loans have been placed in either processing or administrative forbearance the last few months? At one point a representatitve from mohela said that they hadnt received any income based repayment applications. However, I have submitted this a number of times dating back to with my consolidation loans in XX/XX/year> at this point I have most recently submitted a PAYE application which has been acknowledged as received. 

Previously, I have submitted IBR application ( s ) as well as others however my consolidation loans have never been enrolled in a repayment plan other than the highest payment amount of standard repayment plan. They are citing litigation over SAVE program however this has nothing to do with IBR applications and now that PAYE is re-opened it was claimed that they hadn't received any of my applications?! 

One application I submitted via mail which they also said was never received however it was signed for and marked as delivered. At one point they acknowledged that they had received my applications- AND THEN deleted the forms that I uploaded to their website under documents submitted to us and then said they had not received any applications for income based repayment. It's not possible to even apply for consolidation loans without selecting an income based repayment application and submitting it. 

When contacting Mohlea they place my loans keep being palced in a " voluntary forbearance '' which I never consented or asked for instead of the correct " processing '' or " administrative '' forbearance so that interest continues to accrue on my account I believe for the sole purpose of attempting to generate more money. 


Previously I contacted them with the following but did not receive a reply " I understand it may take some additional time to process however this inquiry and communication is to ask why I have been in a voluntary forbearance instead of administrative or processing seeing as I have applied a number of times over the last few months. If you could, please adjust my record of forbearance to reflect the corresponding administrative and processing forbearance that wanting to pay on my loans under an IDR and having applied which implies a pending processing of them litigation or not, that would be ideal. ''

Consumer complaint narrative:
My personal and financial information was compromised without my authorization by a group of outsiders called DOGE. This has been brough to light in the month of XXXX from a lawsuit by students in the state of California. 
Below is direct information from the student loan website that mentions the consequences of third parties from accessing personal information. 

Warning You are accessing a U.S. Federal Government computer system intended to be solely accessed by individual users expressly authorized to access the system by the U.S. Department of Education. Usage may be monitored, recorded, and/or subject to audit. For security purposes and in order to ensure that the system remains available to all expressly authorized users, the U.S. Department of Education monitors the system to identify unauthorized users. Anyone using this system expressly consents to such monitoring and recording. Unauthorized use of this information system is prohibited and subject to criminal and civil penalties. Except as expressly authorized by the U.S. Department of Education, unauthorized attempts to access, obtain, upload, modify, change, and/or delete information on this system are strictly prohibited and are subject to criminal prosecution under 18 U.S.C. 1030, and other applicable statutes, which may result in fines and imprisonment. For purposes of this system, unauthorized access includes, but is not limited to : any access by an employee or agent of a commercial entity, or other third party, who is not the individual user, for purposes of commercial advantage or private financial gain ( regardless of whether the commercial entity or third party is providing a service to an authorized user of the system ) ; and any access in furtherance of any criminal or tortious act in violation of the Constitution or laws of the United States or any State.

If system monitoring reveals information indicating possible criminal activity, such evidence may be provided to law enforcement personnel.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am applying for the IBR payment plan for my Federal Student Loans. I have consolidated them already.

MOHELA has yet to process my IBR application. I applied once during consolidation in XXXX  and again in XXXX  as I was concerned that perhaps they hadn't received my application since it was taking so long. I was able to have my loans put on forbearance until this month, when I started receivin
g late payment notices. I have called multiple times but the only time I was able to get through with my work schedule, they then told me to hold for 1-2 minutes. After being told about the 1-2 minute hold, an automated message made clear that the actual wait was three and a half hours, this is on top of the four hours I had already waited for a callback. I can not afford to take days off of work to deal with MOHELA 's incompetence.

Consumer complaint narrative:
What happened : FSA received documented proof of an account error but has not fixed and continues to fraudulently withdraw student loan payments from my checking account post-PSLF completion. 

XX/XX/XXXX began employment with a qualified nonprofit, where I still work with no disruptions. 

XX/XX/XXXX through XX/XX/XXXX submitted the relevant PSLF forms for employment verification to FSA, in which I completed the 10 year requirement as of XX/XX/XXXX to have my student loan forgiven under the PSLF program. 

41 eligible payments that I made to my loan provider are missing under my FSA account loan history, where no payment records are showing between XX/XX/XXXX to XX/XX/XXXX. 

Loan provider history for your records : - XX/XX/XXXX per FSA Limited PSLF Waiver, loan consolidated from XXXX to XXXX - XX/XX/XXXX per FSA XXXX transferred from XXXX to XXXX What I've done to try to resolve the issue : Complaints requesting my account be accurately updated were submitted with proven payment history documentation on : - XXXX XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX ; all show " still processing '' - FSA XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX ; case # XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
NOTICE TO AGENT IS NOTICE TO PRINCIPAL NOTICE TO PRINCIPAL IS NOTICE TO AGENT. 
I hereby give your Company notice pursuant to 15 USC 1602 ( k ) that your Company never provided an adequate notice which clearly & conspicuously mentions the pertinent facts of this transaction. Your Company didn't even inform about the Cost of Credit and the only evidence of the indebtedness was just a computer-generated agreement. According to 15 USC 1602 ( k ), the term " adequate notice '' means a printed notice to a cardholder which sets forth the pertinent facts clearly and conspicuously so that a person against whom it is to operate could reasonably be expected to have noticed it and understood its meaning. Such notice may be given to a cardholder by printing the notice on any credit card, or on each periodic statement of account, issued to the cardholder, or by any other means reasonably assuring the receipt thereof by the cardholder. Since adequate notice was not given as per the above- mentioned section, I couldn't understand its meaning which is a violation under 15 USC 1602 ( k ). Further, pursuant to 15 USC 1601 ( a ) a consumer must be aware of the cost of transaction. Since I was not aware of the transaction therefore made an uninformed decision and it resulted in multiple billing errors and unfair credit card practices. From your end, I have not benefited from this transaction which is again a violation of 15 USC 1602 ( p ). According to 15 USC 1602 ( p ), the term " unauthorized use '' means a use of a credit card by a person other than the cardholder who does not have actual, implied, or apparent authority for such use and from which the cardholder receives no benefit. I hereby request you to do the below- mentioned things ; DELETE THESE ACCOUNTS OFF MY REPORT AND VALIDATE THE DEBT XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  Account number XXXX Balance {$2200.00} XXXX XXXX XXXX  Account number XXXX Balance {$3400.00} Balance updated XX/XX/year> If you accept my request, I will not escalate this matter to Federal Court. In case you dont accept the above requests, legal action shall be taken against your Company for compensatory damages. Thank you for your attention to this matter. Sincerely, : XXXX XXXX. All Rights Reserved Without Prejudice UCC-1308

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally lodge a complaint regarding the unauthorized access and breach of my educational records, financial aid data, and IRS tax information by the U.S. Department of Education ( DOE ) and the Department of Governmental Efficiency ( DOGE ). This breach constitutes a direct violation of the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act ( FERPA ) and Title IV regulations, as well as an egregious violation of my personal privacy and financial security.

I recently discovered that my sensitive and legally protected records were accessed and potentially shared without my consent. This includes but is not limited to : 1. My academic records and personally identifiable information ( PII ).

2. My Free Application for Federal Student Aid ( FAFSA ) data, including financial aid history and loan information.

3. My IRS tax transcripts, which were obtained and used without proper authorization.

These actions violate my rights under FERPA ( 20 U.S.C. 1232g ; 34 CFR Part 99 ), which grants me the right to control access to my educational records, as well as Title IV of the Higher Education Act, which governs the use and protection of federal student aid information. Furthermore, unauthorized access to my IRS tax data raises serious concerns regarding potential identity theft, fraud, and violations of federal data security standards. 
Given the severity of this breach and the direct impact on my financial security and privacy, I demand the following corrective actions :

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally request the immediate discharge of my federal student loans due to a serious violation of the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act ( FERPA ) ( 20 U.S.C. 1232g, 34 CFR Part 99 ) and related federal privacy laws by XXXX ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX. ) XXXX was allowed to access this data, along with many other classified information, after the creation of the commission by President Trump last month. My personal and financial information, as well as that of my family, was compromised without my authorization, which is a clear violation of FERPA and your institutions responsibility to protect the confidentiality of my records. 

As you are aware, FERPA safeguards the privacy of student records, including personal and financial information. The breach of my data is not only a direct violation of FERPA but also renders any agreements related to my student loans null and void, as it compromises the very contract under which my loans were issued. The unauthorized release of my personal and financial details has caused significant harm, and I believe this breach warrants at minimum, the full discharge of my student loan debt. 

Not only was my own information released without my consent, but also my familys financial information, which was provided during the loan application process. 

Given the severity of this situation, I respectfully request that you immediately cancel and discharge my student loan debt in full. I trust you will address this matter with the urgency it requires and look forward to your prompt response.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing a dispute regarding EFinancials reporting of an account under my name. I have contacted the U.S. Department of Education, and they have confirmed that there is no record of XXXX being the servicer of any federal student loan associated with me. Despite this, XXXX has reported an account under my name without any legal documentation proving their authority.

I am requesting that the CFPB take immediate action and require EFinancial to : 1. **Provide verifiable documentation** proving they are the authorized servicer of my alleged federal student loan.

2. **Cease all credit reporting** of this account unless they can provide lawful proof that I am responsible for it.

3. **Comply with federal laws** regarding student loan servicing and credit reporting. 
If XXXX can not provide proper documentation from the Department of Education, their actions constitute fraudulent reporting and should be addressed accordingly. I request that this account be removed from my credit report immediately if they fail to provide legal proof. 
I appreciate the CFPBs prompt attention to this matter and look forward to a resolution.

I resubmitted this form but have not been able to get in contact with MOHELA regarding the original form or to request it be expedited. 

The wait time to speak with a customer service rep was XXXX hour and XXXX minutes on Tuesday XXXX. The wait time to speak with someone today ( Fri XXXX ) was XXXX hour and XXXX minutes when I called in the morning and never received a call back despite requesting a call when presented with that option ( versus waiting on hold ). When I called back again, the wait time to speak with someone was over XXXX hours.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Under the Higher Education Act of 1965 ( 20 U.S.C. 1070 et seq. ), I am entitled to full and accurate information and original documentation for anything you are trying to charge me with. Additionally, I am entitled to information regarding my loan balance, repayment options, interest rates, and any fees associated with XXXX XXXX XXXX, as well as access to my payment history and information about any potential deferment or forbearance options. Furthermore, I am entitled to all documents with my signature on them that I signed XXXX XXXX XXXX, which you are currently withholding from me. Please note that an XXXX spreadsheet does not constitute the conditions of a contract. 

The more I request and receive the same information from all entities, it seems that each one of you adds or modifies details in the documents you send. There are discrepancies compared to the original one I received in XXXX from XXXX. Everyone has conveniently added more information into the XXXX, and I do have the original encrypted message from XXXX that clearly shows this information wasn't there before. This is just a generic document, which is, number XXXX, not legible. According to contract law, the form must be legible. 

Moreover, the shutdown of Conduent due to poor loan servicing practices and my unsuccessful attempts to obtain documentation over the past five years only exacerbate my concerns regarding the validity of my loan. My records show no evidence of payments made from XXXX to XXXX, despite having utilized forbearances and deferments. 
To whom it may concern, I am writing to formally request the original documentation related to my loan, including all signed loan documents. It is imperative to note that I am not interested in a generic Master Promissory Note ( MPN ) or loan amount ; rather, I require the specific documents that bear my original signature. 

It has come to my attention that the documents you have previously provided do not reflect my consent and obligations accurately. Furthermore, despite my repeated requests, I have yet to receive a copy of the signature that appears on these forms. 

As per Colorado contract law, specifically referencing the statute signed by the Governor of Colorado, you are obligated to provide these materials within five days of my request. It is concerning that, as a financial institution tasked with the responsible handling of monetary transactions, you are unable to present the necessary documentation that underpins this loan agreement. 

I have 5 MPNs that are different from the last
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Consumer complaint narrative:
To the Departments Overseeing School & Loan Server Compliance, We are writing as a collective group of defrauded students and alumni who attended XXXX schools, urging immediate action to approve outstanding Borrower Defense applications and provide full relief for those impacted. 

Many of us attended the following institutions owned by or affiliated with XXXX, where misrepresentations and predatory practices have been well-documented : * XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX The Department of Education has already found significant evidence of misconduct by these schools. Specifically, XXXX XXXX  misrepresented job placement rates to prospective students between XXXX and XXXX, falsely claiming that 90 % of graduates secured jobs in their field of study within XXXX months of graduation. This claim, widely advertised in national campaigns and direct mailings, was later revealed to be grossly inaccurate. XXXX included old jobs held by mid-career students before enrolling and excluded graduates who found employment outside their field of study. 

At its peak, XXXX enrolled nearly XXXX students across campuses in XXXX states and through an online program accessible nationwide. The scale of this deception has left countless students burdened with unmanageable debt and limited opportunities, as documented in the Department of Educations Borrower Defense Executive Summary and Statements of Facts. 

We are asking you to take immediate steps to : 1. Approve all outstanding Borrower Defense applications for students who attended these institutions.

2. Discharge all loans associated with fraudulent practices, including consolidated loans.

3. Repair borrowers credit reports to reflect the removal of these fraudulent debts.

Delaying action only prolongs the harm caused by these predatory institutions, leaving borrowers unable to move forward with their lives. Many of us pursued higher education to achieve the XXXX XXXX, but this dream was stolen by the very institutions we trusted to help us achieve it. 

We implore you to act decisively to ensure justice for all borrowers who were misled and exploited. The stakes are simply too high to risk further delays. 

Thank you for your attention to this urgent matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
I submitted an application on XX/XX/XXXX for a reduced monthly payment. It is XX/XX/XXXX and I still have not heard back. It has been XXXX  months. 

I have emailed and called repeatedly over the last 2 months. Wait times on the phone for customer service are XXXX, XXXX or XXXX hours long. I finally took a day off of work ( and woke up at XXXX ) so I could sit on the phone and talk to a customer service agent. The agent could not find my application- could not figure out why it wasn't processed. She said she would put my account in forbearance so I would not have to make another payment until the application was processed. After I got off the phone ( which lasted hours )- I checked my account and NOTHING changed!! There was no forbearance put into place. There was no email. There was no record that I even spoke to anyone. And now my XXXX payment ( XXXX ) is due and I can not afford it! I don't want to get bad credit from a missed payment. I will pay my bill! I just need a lower payment! HELP PLEASE! 


I've emailed over and over again. The replies are auto generated. There is no information that applies to my specific situation or to my account. The replies will say " Our records indicate that you have already called and spoken to XXXX of our Customer Service Representatives regarding this inquiry. If you need additional assistance, please contact us at the number listed below. '' - I have only spoken to a representative XXXX time, so this is not true. And it's ridiculous to say to contact them at their number ... XXXX just tried to call again and the wait time is XXXX hours. No one has XXXX hours to wait for a customer service agent!!!! 


Can I please have my student loans transferred to a more competent loan servicer. I can see online that MOHELA has a horrible reputation.

Issue: Dealing with your lender or servicer
Sub-issue: Problem with customer service
Consumer complaint narrative:
This letter is a statement of dissatisfaction with the XXXX XXXX XXXX servicing company MOHELA. My son was the recipient of and unneeded loan as a result of the XXXX process. He inadvertently signed up for a non-subsidized loan to cover college tuition expenses that he did want or need as XXXX moneys cover he tuition costs making a loan unnecessary. As a result he was rewarded a refund at the end of his first term by XXXX XXXX XXXX thus notifying us of the loan 's existence. 

We attempted to use MOHELA 's website to make a payment in XX/XX/XXXX to so we would not accrue any interest against the balance owing. The payment never posted to my son 's account and at the end of the second term we discovered the initial disbursement showed unpaid and that {$XXXX} of interest had accrued. There was also a discrepancy in the Principal amount of the loan disbursed compared to the amount XXXX XXXX XXXX reported receiving. The difference of {$XXXX} for each disbursement had no explanation attached to it. I have since learned that the {$XXXX} was a loan service fee but no where on my son 's account was that indicated and I had to learn that by scouring the XXXX XXXX XXXX website. 

In XX/XX/XXXX we again used the MOHELA 's website to pay off the principal balance to include the {$XXXX} of interest that had accrued since the first disbursement in XX/XX/XXXX, which we had tried to avoid by attempting to make the payment in XXXX. The payment transaction posted to our bank account on XX/XX/XXXX but after a week we did not see any indication that MOHELA had received the payment and interest was still accruing on the new principal balance that should be {$XXXX}. We then tried to contact MOHELA via both email and telephone to inquire about the difference in the outstanding principal balance versus amount of money disbursed to XXXX XXXX XXXX and about the lack of documentation on whether or not the payment had posted to my son 's account. The initial email contact was submitted and received through MOHELA 's web portal and did not answer any of our questions posed to them about the loan status but appeared to be a XXXX response indicating that they are only a loan servicer and to contact the school FA department if there are issues with the loan. We responded again through the web portal advising our plan to not pay the amount in question ( {$XXXX} for each disbursement ) until an explanation could be provided. I left our phone number for them to call ... ... no response was received. 

On XX/XX/XXXX we were on hold with MOHELA customer service for XXXX hours without speaking to a company representative. On XX/XX/XXXX, we were on hold for XXXX hours prior to speaking to a customer service representative that answered XXXX of my questions, regarding the difference in the outstanding principal compared to money disbursed, but could not answer additional questions as to why my payment had not posted to our son 's account after XXXX  days of the money being withdrawn from our bank account and how to stop further disbursements. I was put back on hold and waited and additional XXXX hours on hold so speak to an Advanced Customer Service Agent but was unceremoniously hung up on at XXXX XXXX  ( XXXX XXXX ) without any notification. They simply closed for the day and did not acknowledge that I had been on hold all day. 

On Monday, XX/XX/XXXX we again attempted to speak to MOHELA customer service via phone. After XXXX hours we spoke to a customer service representative and again were told we needed to speak to an Advance Customer Service XXXX and were put on hold. This time we chose to receive a call from MOHELA customer Service by providing them our phone number within their automated phone tree. The recording indicated that MOHELA would return the phone call in their order they received it. It is now XX/XX/XXXX and we have not received a call from MOHELA and thus the reason for this letter. 

MOHELA is supposed to be servicing loans through the federal government financial aid system and all they appear to be doing is making sure they make as much money off of a students as they can by nickel and diming their customers. The lack of response to any of our inquiries made to MOHELA clearly show that they are not a customer service based entity. Students deserve better as they try to navigate a confusing collegiate experience only to be compounded by uncertainty and exploitation at the hands of a financial institution that his supposedly there to help and service the student. 

Our experience with MOHELA has been awful and ours is a very simple loan of only XXXX disbursements that we did not even want or need. I could not image being student with financial hardship and having to try and get information from MOHELA that XXXX be vital to their financial advancement/well being only to get nothing in response when they need the information. MOHELA is not a loan servicer worthy of being associated with the XXXX student aid programs. 

I will be sending a MOHELA a check for the {$XXXX} outstanding but will not be responsible for any additional interested accrued on the already paid balance that MOHELA may try to add on to my son 's account. We have canceled the scheduled third disbursement to XXXX XXXX XXXX via the school 's XXXX XXXX department. This should have been easily available through MOHELA themselves. MOHELA 's lack of response to their customers is deplorable. 



XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
My name is XXXX XXXX and my daughter, XXXX XXXX, attended XXXX XXXX from XXXX - XXXX. Our XXXX  application/case is against XXXX XXXX XXXX My case # is XXXX. I have filed at least XXXX complaints, contacted the ombudsman 3 times ( received incorrect, poor information - I know the laws better than them ), left 5 messages for the caseworker & was assured a response, yet never received XXXX. I would like my complaint to go to the Office of Federal Student Aid AND the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 

Complaint to : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  FSA Ombudsman Group XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, KY XXXX and to : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX Federal Student Aid XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, KY XXXX Subject : Formal Complaint Regarding Inequitable Processing of Borrower Defense Applications Dear Federal Student Aid Team, I am writing to express my concerns regarding the inequitable handling of Borrower Defense to Repayment applications. My individual Borrower Defense application, submitted on XX/XX/XXXX, has been pending for an extended period without resolution. My application reference number is XXXX. 

I understand that the Department of Education has up to three years to process applications under current regulations. However, I am deeply concerned about the apparent disparity between the timeframes for adjudicating class action Borrower Defense applications versus individual applications like mine. Publicly available information suggests that class action cases are being resolved in significantly less time, while individual borrowers are left waiting without transparency or communication regarding timelines. 

This discrepancy raises questions about the prioritization of cases and whether individual applicants are being treated fairly under the Departments principles of equity and accountability. It is also unclear why resources are being directed disproportionately toward resolving group claims while leaving individual borrowers in prolonged uncertainty. 

The delay in processing my application has caused significant hardship, including : - Accrual of over {$20000.00} in interest when interest is not supposed to accrue after 6 months from applying for XXXX and during in school deferment - Emotional stress stemming from absolute fear of crushing debt - Fear for XXXX XXXX because the illegal actions and abuse against her by XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  I have implored, over and over, that someone read through her Borrower 's Defense case to see how overwhelming the proof of abuse and illegal actions by XXXX are - to the point of one top director of the whole of Student Affairs was FIRED by XXXX for 'hostile work environment ' - the same director who XXXX XXXXXXXX and denied her all rights for 4 years at this college- the disparity in processing timelines causing the loss of discharge due to new administration impact. That disparity and lack of equity and accountability would pile debt and hardship on my daughter who received NO education and was DENIED her rights to due process and her human rights and, instead, abused by administration of XXXX I respectfully request clarification on the following points : Why class action XXXX XXXX applications are being resolved more quickly than individual applications. 
What measures the Department is taking to ensure fair and equitable processing of all applications, regardless of case type. 
The current status of my individual application and how to achieve equity in adjudicating it now. 

I kindly urge the Department to address this inequity and provide greater transparency about how resources are allocated between class action and individual cases. This will help rebuild trust with borrowers and ensure fairness in the process. In ensuring this fairness and equity, it's evident that our individual application must be completed now, to demonstrate fairness and lack of discriminatory practice. 

I look forward to receiving a response upon receipt of this letter. Please feel free to contact me at : XXXX, or XXXX, to show the Department 's commitment to ensuring all borrowers their equitable rights. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. 

XXXX XXXX
Company: Servicer under contract with Federal Student Aid

Issue: Struggling to repay your loan
Sub-issue: Problem with your payment plan
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am submitting this complaint to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau regarding my challenges with managing over {$100000.00} in student loan debt. Since XXXX  recently, I have been unable to secure stable employment and am experiencing significant financial hardship. Despite reaching out to my loan servicer to request assistance through forbearance or income-driven repayment options, I have encountered obstacles that are causing me distress. The lack of clear guidance and responsive customer service has made it difficult to navigate my options effectively, leaving me at risk of financial instability. 

My primary concerns include the servicers failure to provide timely and accurate information about available relief programs, including forbearance and income-driven repayment plans. Additionally, I have been subjected to confusing communication regarding interest accrual during forbearance periods and unclear timelines for application processing. These issues have compounded my financial strain and delayed my ability to stabilize my situation. I believe these practices undermine borrowers rights and create undue hardship, especially for recent graduates like myself who are in a vulnerable financial position.

Consumer complaint narrative:
In XXXX my account was not shown as having a balance that needed to be paid. Not only that, but I have active autopay. There was no payment taken out of my account, and yet I received communication that my account was delinquent. When I reached out to Mohela they responded on XX/XX/year> and said that my Autopay was active, but no explanation on why I did not have a bill on my account for XXXX, all they said is I was overdue, even with autopay active. 

Fast forward to XXXX and the same thing happened. I checked my account at least XXXX times waiting for either a bill for an amount due, or a confirmation that my autopay was used, but nothing showed up. So, not only was I not able to pay, now I have more messages saying I am delinquent. 

I have zero financial issues on my end and I have the ability to make my payment every single month without hesitation, in fact I have my autopay set to pay double what my minimum payment is, but Mohela is making it look as if I am delinquent on paying.

I am concerned that this is going to affect my credit score moving forward, and I am concerned that it has now happened twice in the last few months.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am a XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX holder, and this loan type has caused significant and ongoing hardship for my family. Both wife and I have been educators in public schools for the past 30 years. 

We are now retired with our student loans ballooning due to accrued and capitalized interest to over {$150.00}, XXXX. This is unjust especially since we are not eligible for PSLF due to our loan type XXXX. The loans should have been separated two years ago when the XXXX law was passed in XXXX. 

My complaint is that the law to separate these loans passed in XX/XX/XXXX. As of XX/XX/XXXX, nothing has been done to separate these loans. In addition, we continue to be ineligible for PSLF due to our loan type and the seemingly deliberate delay in the Department of Education in separating our loan to transfer to direct loans so we can qualify for PSLF. 

Because of this delay, we continue to experience hardship on a teacher retirement income with several illnesses. We can not afford to pay the loans. We should have been able to separate and receive PSLF, except for the Dept. Ed. deliberate delay in completing the process. 

It is unlawful that the process and the law have not been followed. The Department of Education delay has caused severe emotional, physical and financial hardship. It is unjust and unlawful. 

We need to know when the process for separation will be completed and if our PSLF will be implemented. 

Current FSA complaint numbers : XXXX case # XXXX XXXX case # XXXX I have made several complaints to the Dept. of Ed ombudsmen since XXXX with no resolution.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX, I received a letter from Mohela titled " Interest Accrual During Forbearance '' in which they told me that interest accrues on my account and I have the option to pay interest. The year prior, I had paid my student loans via auto debit from my bank account. So, in a panic, I made a payment on XX/XX/XXXX to try to offset interest. My payment never showed up on my account, so I called Mohela, and they had no trace of the payment. They told me I used the wrong account number since apparently everyone got new account numbers over the summer ( since the last time my payment was auto paid from my bank with my old account number ). They also told me that letter was sent to everyone by mistake. 

With my new account number, I contacted my bank in person to try to cancel or redirect the payment. They can not do anything -- so I contacted Mohela for a refund. After being on hold for XXXX and a half hours, I spoke to an " advanced agent '' who said she was looking into the matter and asked me to wait on a brief hold *seven* times. After she put me on hold for the XXXX time, they hung up on me. I called back and the estimated wait was XXXX hours and XXXX minutes. Instead, I called the bill pay customer support through my bank, and they are opening a research ticket on my behalf. I am hopeful they will be able to resolve the issue. 

However, I urge the CFPB to investigate MOHELA on a nationwide level of scamming student loan borrows -- - from deflecting phone calls, sending out letters of disinformation, to disappearing payments without a trace. I am not the only XXXX in this boat. Please read the countless testimonies on XXXX ( Mohela group, PSLF group ), XXXX, and XXXX  platforms for a broader scope of the various pits of XXXX we have endured. 

Thank you
