I respectfully request that Nelnet issue the full refund of {$10000.00} to the original payment method used on XX/XX/XXXX. I also ask that Nelnet take immediate steps to ensure this matter is resolved, as their actions constitute an Unfair and Deceptive Practice under applicable consumer protection laws. Issue: Dealing with your lender or servicer
Sub-issue: Received bad information about your loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing a formal complaint against Nelnet, my federal student loan servicer, due to a breach of my personal and financial information without my authorization. This violation contradicts FERPA, the Privacy Act of 1974, and other federal regulations that protect student loan borrowers ' confidential information.

When I raised this issue with Nelnet, they deflected responsibility and claimed that the Department of Education owns all loan records, refusing to take corrective action or provide any security assurances regarding my compromised data. Their response was insufficient and dismissive, failing to address the severity of this breach and the risk posed to my financial security. 

I am requesting the CFPB to investigate the following : How my personal and financial data was compromised and whether Nelnet failed to adhere to federal data protection requirements. 
Why Nelnet has refused to provide a resolution or take accountability for the mishandling of my personal information. 
Whether I qualify for a full loan discharge due to this violation. 
Additionally, I am requesting clear next steps for escalating this matter within the Department of Education if Nelnet continues to deflect responsibility. 

This is a serious violation of borrower rights, and I expect a formal response and resolution within the required timeframe.

I listed them along with the other that I hoping late and inaccurate as it was consolidated. To one payment not multiple payments Creditor Name XXXX  XXXX XXXX payment {$11.00} XXXX XXXX ( should be no payment on this payment ) {$16.00} XXXX XXXX {$33.00} payment XXXX XXXX {$19.00} There can't be payments reported by themselves for this they are included in XXXXXXXX XXXX loan XXXX I am wondering when this was verified for accuracy none of the Information is showing accurate. And true and I misleading.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Immediate Action Needed : Approve Outstanding Borrower Defense Applications To the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, We are writing as a collective group of defrauded students and alumni who attended XXXXaffiliated schools, urging immediate action to approve outstanding Borrower Defense applications and provide full relief for those impacted. 

Many of us attended the following institutions owned by or affiliated with XXXX, where misrepresentations and predatory practices have been well-documented : * XXXX University XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX University XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX University XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX University XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX University XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Department of Education has already found significant evidence of misconduct by these schools. Specifically, XXXX University misrepresented job placement rates to prospective students between XXXX and XXXX, falsely claiming that 90 % of graduates secured jobs in their field of study within six months of graduation. This claim, widely advertised in national campaigns and direct mailings, was later revealed to be grossly inaccurate. XXXX included old jobs held by mid-career students before enrolling and excluded graduates who found employment outside their field of study. 

At its peak, XXXX enrolled nearly 70,000 students across campuses in 26 states and through an online program accessible nationwide. The scale of this deception has left countless students burdened with unmanageable debt and limited opportunities, as documented in the Department of Educations Borrower Defense Executive Summary and Statements of Facts.

We are asking you to take immediate steps to : 1. Approve all outstanding Borrower Defense applications for students who attended these institutions.

2. Discharge all loans associated with fraudulent practices, including consolidated loans.

3. Repair borrowers credit reports to reflect the removal of these fraudulent debts.

Delaying action only prolongs the harm caused by these predatory institutions, leaving borrowers unable to move forward with their lives. Many of us pursued higher education to achieve the American Dream, but this dream was stolen by the very institutions we trusted to help us achieve it. 

We implore you to act decisively to ensure justice for all borrowers who were misled and exploited. The stakes are simply too high to risk further delays. 

Thank you for your attention to this urgent matter. 

Sincerely, Students & Graduates of XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
I would like to file a formal complaint against my loan servicer, Nelnet. I do not believe they are handling my loans correctly and are deceptively allocating payments exclusively to one loan and not across loans which is an intended behavior designed to maximize interest fees. Also, Nelnet has been negligent in applying payments timely to decrease in daily interest compounding and increasing their earnings through interest.

Delay in processing I have been tracking the behavior of Nelnet. Recently, I have scheduled a group of daily payments. Nelnet processes the payments at the END OF BUSINESS DAY allowing Nelnet to collect interest for the day. It is taking 2-3 days for Nelnet to process a scheduled payment and there is no retroactive change to the {$9.00} daily interest I am paying. 

Payments are not being applied to my account timely AND not at all I made {$400.00} in payments via a bank check, both checks have been cashed and both checks have not been applied to my account. When I inquired, I was told I was wrong. When I filed a complaint with the Department of Education, I was told it takes XXXX ( XXXX ) days even though I submitted proof and feel as though there is no sense of urgency. Furthermore, HOW DOES THIS HAPPEN?!?!?! How do we have {$400.00} USD freely in a pay bucket and not applied to my account? 

Nelnet is not applying the payments across my XXXX loans and/or Fails to correctly apply or allocate borrower payments to their accounts We learned from the Navient lawsuit that the loan servicer is supposed to apply borrower payments across multiple loan. In XXXX, I made {$880.00} in payments and XXXX of my loans have not received any payments since XXXX of 2024. 

In addition, my loan was formerly serviced by Navient. I would like to know if my account has been properly audited for misconduct and would like a full account printed document of ALL payments received throughout the life of the loan. I look forward to your response.

Consumer complaint narrative:
To the Departments Overseeing School & Loan Server Compliance, We are writing as a collective group of defrauded students and alumni who attended XXXXaffiliated schools, urging immediate action to approve outstanding Borrower Defense applications and provide full relief for those impacted.

Many of us attended the following institutions owned by or affiliated with XXXX, where misrepresentations and predatory practices have been well-documented : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX The Department of Education has already found significant evidence of misconduct by these schools. Specifically, XXXXXXXX XXXX misrepresented job placement rates to prospective students between XXXX and XXXX, falsely claiming that 90 % of graduates secured jobs in their field of study within six months of graduation. This claim, widely advertised in national campaigns and direct mailings, was later revealed to be grossly inaccurate. XXXX included old jobs held by mid-career students before enrolling and excluded graduates who found employment outside their field of study. 
At its peak, XXXX enrolled nearly XXXX students across campuses in 26 states and through an online program accessible nationwide. The scale of this deception has left countless students burdened with unmanageable debt and limited opportunities, as documented in the Department of Educations Borrower Defense Executive Summary and Statements of Facts.

We are asking you to take immediate steps to : 1. Approve all outstanding Borrower Defense applications for students who attended these institutions. 
2. Discharge all loans associated with fraudulent practices, including consolidated loans.

3. Repair borrowers credit reports to reflect the removal of these fraudulent debts.

Delaying action only prolongs the harm caused by these predatory institutions, leaving borrowers unable to move forward with their lives. Many of us pursued higher education to achieve the American Dream, but this dream was stolen by the very institutions we trusted to help us achieve it.

We implore you to act decisively to ensure justice for all borrowers who were misled and exploited. The stakes are simply too high to risk further delays.

Thank you for your attention to this urgent matter. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX

Issue: Improper use of your report
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
Student Loan Validation Letter XXXX XXXX XXXX Morning XXXX XXXX. # XXXX XXXX XXXX, MD XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX po box XXXX XXXX, PA XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, TX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, GA XXXX To Whom It May Concern, Subject : Request for Original Promissory Note or Removal of Accounts from Consumer Report This letter is a formal request regarding the student loan debt ( s ) that you have reported on my consumer credit report. Please be advised that this is NOT a refusal to pay but a request sent pursuant to the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 U.S.C. 1692g, and the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). I am disputing the validity of the alleged debt ( s ), and I am requesting proper validation. 
This is NOT a request for mere verification of my mailing address or other peripheral information, but a formal demand for competent evidence that establishes my legal obligation to pay this debt and the right of your office to report it to consumer reporting agencies. 
Specifically, I request the following : Account Information : Account Name : Dept of Edu/XXXX  Account Number : XXXX, XXXX, XXXX Account Name : Dept of Education/OSLA  SRV Account Number : XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX XXXX. Proof of Debt : I respectfully demand that you provide a copy of the original wet-ink promissory note or other documents that serve as the foundation of the alleged debt ( s ) you claim I owe. The absence of such documentation violates my rights under the FCRA, FDCPA, and any applicable state laws. You must provide evidence proving your legal authority to report this debt. 
2. Failure to Provide Proof : Should you be unable to furnish the original promissory note or other valid documentation within 30 days from receipt of this letter, I request that you immediately cease reporting this account to any and all consumer credit reporting agencies and remove it from my credit file. The continued reporting of unsubstantiated debts is a violation of the FCRA and may also constitute fraud. If no response is received within the 30-day window, I will pursue all available legal actions to ensure compliance.

3. Correction of Consumer Report : If your office decides to remove the accounts from my report, I request written confirmation of this removal, along with written verification from the credit bureaus that the accounts have been deleted.

Further, this letter serves as a Formal Notice under the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act ( FERPA ) : The unauthorized disclosure of my student loan-related information to consumer reporting agencies without my written consent may also be a violation of FERPA. I have not provided consent for such disclosure. Therefore, I demand immediate cessation of reporting and removal of all student loan-related accounts from my consumer report.

I expect the following actions within 30 days : Immediate Cease of Reporting : Cease reporting any and all student loan-related information to credit reporting agencies.

Removal of All Accounts : Remove all related student loan accounts from my consumer reports. 
Written Confirmation : Provide written verification from your office and the credit reporting agencies confirming these actions. 
If these requests are not honored within the required time, I will consult with my legal counsel and pursue all legal remedies available to me, including claims under the FDCPA, FCRA, and FERPA. 
Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. Failure to comply will result in further legal action. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Issue: Dealing with your lender or servicer
Sub-issue: Trouble with how payments are being handled
Consumer complaint narrative:
Hello, I believe I am taken advantage of by XXXX. 

On XX/XX/XXXX I paid {$1500.00} towards my student loans spread across the 7 loans. This was before interest started accruing. I received a payment confirmation email on XX/XX/XXXX XXXX PM from XXXX. 

After this I thought i was good. I waited until around the next bill was. I thought that was weird that I still had the same balance. I checked the history, and I saw that it was reversed. I was let down because that let a lot of interest accrue. I check my email, and do not see any notification that it was reversed. I did not pay attention to my savings account during this span because I knew I had more than enough to pay. I looked past it, and I paid for XXXX XXXX bill on XX/XX/XXXX - {$250.00} across the XXXX loans. I received another payment confirmation email on XX/XX/XXXX. 

I am checking now a month later on XX/XX/XXXX that it was reversed again. I called their support line on XX/XX/XXXX to figure out what was wrong. I gave my information and explained what the issue was, I was put on hold while they were looking into the issue. Later, I was told that it was strange that it was reversed and to call my bank. I asked them to confirm the account number on my account. They said they could not provide that. Understandably, but I realized it would not have been ever activated if that was the case. They said that it could be my bank blocking it. My bank has a stringent alert process, and would've let me know if they blocked a {$1500.00} dollar payment and even a {$250.00} payment. 

I've found many others have been fooled this way, and edifinancial is actually reversing the payments and have lousy notification process on purpose. Why send a payment confirmation email if it did not go through?

YOUR COMPLAINT From XX/XX/XXXX thru XX/XX/XXXX I attended XXXX XXXX XXXX in XXXXXXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX. 
Right before XXXX the area news was there and students were protesting about allegations of accreditation and lending issues. Me and other classmates were worried so we asked teachers and principal about what's going on and they told us that it's nothing we should worry about and that we are fine. We were weeks before XXXX and red flags was starting already. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXXXXXX XXXX. A couple months later the school had completely closed. Next thing you know I was getting contacted by law offices asking did I want to join multi class suits with other students. I consulted with XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX guaranteed job placement after XXXX and I heard nothing from them at all after XXXX. So after being unemployed for months I had to contact Sallie Mae about forbearance but that only lasted for a short period of time. Next thing you know Sallie Mae gave our loans to Navient school loans. By then the loans were collecting interest because XXXX XXXX had me to sign for a subsidized, unsubsidized, private loans totaling about {$24000.00} at the time. I was continuously was searching for employment but could find anything in my field. I was XXXX XXXX XXXX with a XXXX XXXX daughter and starting suffering major financial hardships. I kept up with necessary paperwork for loan providers. I found a job but it was paying a little over minimum wage at the time. I could barely pay rent or anything due to being unemployed for so long after XXXX. So in XXXX my child and I relocated to XXXXXXXX with my mom and stepdad. By then the interest accrued so bad I had to get my loans consolidated not knowing that it made my loans reached almost {$55000.00}. I was still being contacted by Navient to pay loans and redo payment plan. After years of doing forbearance Navient finally offered income contingent plan for repayment. 
Since I had low income I didn't have to pay anything until I made moderate income to even pay. I constantly was contacting the school and Attorney General XXXX XXXX about help with school loans discharged but they still had a ongoing case and it was summer XXXX and it was almost time to redo payment plan papers again. XXXX XXXX hit and I redid my in XXXXXXXX payment plan again. XX/XX/XXXX I filed my taxes not knowing anything at all about my file was placement for default through the Department of Education at all. Then while waiting on taxes I get a letter from them saying I'm in default and my entire income tax of {$9700.00} was sent to Department of Education for loans. 
Then I was sent a letter from Navient that I was going through garnishment of wages because the income contingent papers I had sent wasn't finished because it was missing a signature. 
Navient failed to even help or notify me of default or garnishment at all. My credit then dropped from about XXXX to negative XXXX. I was devastated completely. I had to contact XXXXXXXX XXXX and pay them for credit repair for a year. Then also make on time payment for a year through Navient to get out of default. Spring XXXX approached and I made it out of default and credit went up but I was still struggling living with my parents. I kept trying to contact Attorney general in XXXX but they sent a paper saying to explain my situation. It is now XX/XX/XXXX. My life has been traumatized by debt collector from school loans, credit being bad reported, and having severe financial hardships. Issue: Dealing with your lender or servicer
Sub-issue: Problem with customer service
Consumer complaint narrative:
In early to midXXXX XXXX, information from DoE and MOHELA was distributed that other repayment programs eligible for PSLF would be available if a borrower wanted to leave the SAVE program in order to begin repayment.

" Borrowers may apply for IDR plans and/or to consolidate loans by using the online applications for Income-Driven Repayment ( IDR ) Plan Application Alternatively, borrowers continue to have the option of submitting a paper application by downloading and printing a PDF form.

Borrowers may apply for different income-driven repayment ( IDR ) plans depending on their individual circumstances. We encourage borrowers to review the specifics of each IDR plan in order to make the best choices for their circumstances. For example, if a borrower enrolls in an IBR Plan and then moves to a different repayment plan, accrued and unpaid interest will capitalize ( be added to the principal balance ). 

Borrowers are still permitted to apply for IDR plans, including SAVE ( previously known as REPAYE ), even though the court has enjoined some of the SAVE and other IDR plan provisions, including forgiveness. The terms of the SAVE Plan and other IDR plans are subject to the outcome of ongoing litigation.

A summary of each plans current application and enrollment availability is as follows : SAVE ( previously known as REPAYE ) : Can apply ; will be placed in forbearance Income-Based Repayment ( IBR ) : Can apply Income-Contingent Repayment ( ICR ) : Can apply. Note : Borrowers who have Direct Consolidation Loans that repaid PLUS loans made to parents can apply only for the ICR Plan Pay As You Earn ( PAYE ) : Can apply Servicers have begun processing certain IDR applications that were paused following court orders affecting the terms and availability of IDR plans.

Specifically, processing has resumed for borrowers applications to enroll in the IBR, ICR, and PAYE Plans. Servicers are also processing recalculations and recertifications for IBR, ICR, and PAYE. Servicers will have applications in the queue that will take some time to work through. Processing for SAVE ( formerly known as REPAYE ) applications and applications where borrowers selected lowest monthly payment will remain paused. Borrowers should check back to this page for future updates. '' On XX/XX/XXXX, I submitted an application for IBR via XXXX and because I could not figure out which plan was best for me, selected the option to allow the servicer to select a plan. Nothing happened. The application was still under review. Then information came out that the IDRs would be processed beginning XX/XX/XXXX. In effect, for two months, an application that was properly submitted, MOHELA did nothing with. On Monday, XX/XX/XXXX, I emailed MOHELA to check the status of this XXXXBR application but decided to call on Tuesday, XX/XX/XXXX. I sat on hold for 1 hour 39 minutes and 27 seconds waiting for a representative. I was able to speak with XXXX and when asked what the status of the IBR application was that was submitted XX/XX/XXXX, he advised, they only " recently '' began reviewing applications. When I asked what " recently '' meant, he advised he could not provide a specific date, but " last week. '' When I asked why nothing was processed until " last week, '' he could not provide an explanation. When I stated that it feels as though MOHELA does not care about its customers, he replied that MOHELA does. When I asked him to explain how it is that MOHELA cares, he could not provide an explanation. 

I understand a company does not need to care about its customers. However, it seems to me that it is good overall business practice for a company to in fact care about its customers, to accurately provide information, to timely process applications, and to understand that as a customer, I actually DO want to pay my student loan. The longer I sit in this general forbearance that is ineligible for PSLF credit, the longer I am indebted to the DoE. I know that I am not alone in wanting to pay my student loans and wanting this weight of owing what is essentially a house that I will never live in to be paid off so that one day, I may actually own a house I can live in.

I am frustrated with MOHELAs lack of transparency as to the reasoning for NOT processing applications for IBR for over three months. I am frustrated with MOHELA not taking any appropriate action and processing the applications when submitted. I can not think of a single business where failing to process applications would not be actionable. At the very least, MOHELA could have acknowledged receipt of the IBR application and provided information that they would not be processing or to advise when they began processing. 

I fully understand how a new presidential administration can impact the student loans and the DoE. However, the failure to process applications prior to the elections in XX/XX/XXXX is unacceptable. The failure to process applications beginning in XX/XX/XXXX, when DoE provided information/guidance that servicers would begin processing applications and MOHELAs decision to not comply with this and the failure to communicate why it was not processing applications is unacceptable. MOHELA is keeping me unnecessarily on hold and from making payments that would in fact qualify for PSLF as guaranteed in the Master Promissory notes of ALL of my student loans, so long as I am employed by an employer who qualifies.
Company public response: Company believes it acted appropriately as authorized by contract or law

Issue: Incorrect information on your report
Sub-issue: Account status incorrect
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally file a complaint regarding issues I have been experiencing with my student loan servicer, EDFINANCIAL. Despite my efforts to resolve directly with them, I have encountered persistent challenges that remain unaddressed and are negatively impacting my financial well-being.

My servicer has misreported my loan status to credit bureaus, negatively affecting my credit score.

I have made multiple attempts to resolve these concerns by calling, emailing, submitting written requests, etc... to loan EDFINANCIAL. However, I have not received a satisfactory response or resolution.

I am seeking CFPB 's assistance in ensuring that EDFINANCIAL corrects any errors in my loan records.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Formal Complaint Regarding Wrongful Interest Accrual on Student Loan under the SAVE Plan I am filing a formal complaint regarding wrongful and improper interest accrual on my student loan account, which is serviced by Aidvantage, while I have been enrolled in the Saving on a Valuable Education ( SAVE ) Plan. This complaint pertains to a charge of {$30.00} in interest that was wrongfully applied to my account, despite the provisions of the SAVE Plan, which clearly state that interest should not accrue during this period of {$0.00} payments.

Summary of the Complaint : 1. Interest Accrued Despite Eligibility for {$0.00} Payments On XX/XX/XXXX, I discovered that {$30.00} in interest had been charged to my account. As per the terms of the SAVE Plan, I am eligible for XXXX XXXX monthly payments due to my income. The SAVE Plan explicitly guarantees that borrowers will not accrue interest while making {$0.00} payments. This is a key provision of the plan, which is meant to prevent the accumulation of unnecessary debt for borrowers. Therefore, the interest accrual on my account is a clear violation of the terms outlined in the SAVE Plan and federal guidelines governing student loans. 


2. Misleading and Inadequate Response from Aidvantage Shortly after discovering the erroneous interest charge, I contacted Aidvantage, my loan servicer. I spoke with a representative who assured me that the interest would be removed from my account. However, despite this assurance, the {$30.00} in interest has not been removed. I also spoke with a supervisor in XX/XX/XXXX, who was unable to explain the source of the interest charge. The supervisor acknowledged the issue but could not provide a reasonable or reliable explanation for why the charge was applied. Furthermore, the supervisor promised to follow up with additional information but never called back, leaving me without any resolution. 


XXXX. Press Release by XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  In response to the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX siding in favor of a lawsuit led by XXXX attorney general and five other Republican-led states, which argued the Department of Education lacks the authority to carry out the SAVE program, Education Secretary XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX a press release on XX/XX/XXXX that, " The XXXX XXXX borrowers enrolled in the SAVE plan will be placed in an interest-free forbearance. '' This statement confirms that borrowers in the SAVE Plan were not supposed to have any interest accrue during this period. Therefore, the interest charge applied to my account violates both the intent and provisions of the SAVE Plan.

4. Violation of the SAVE Plans Interest Waiver Provisions The SAVE Plan explicitly states that borrowers making {$0.00} payments will not have interest accrue on their loans. Furthermore, the U.S. Department of Education, along with XXXX XXXX XXXX, confirmed that no interest should be accruing during this period for borrowers enrolled in the program. This was further reinforced by a temporary interest-free forbearance granted to all eligible borrowers during the XXXX period. Despite these protections, interest was still erroneously applied to my account, which directly contradicts the terms of the program. 


5. Federal Protections and Legal Violations Aidvantages actions may be in violation of several federal laws and regulations, including : The Higher Education Act of XXXX : This law governs federal student loans and outlines the rights of borrowers, including protections against wrongful interest accrual. 

The Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) : This act prohibits unfair practices related to debt collection, including the improper charging of interest.

The Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ) : This act mandates accurate and transparent disclosure of loan terms and conditions, including the proper application of interest rates.

The wrongful application of interest and failure to provide proper documentation regarding the charges is a violation of my rights as a borrower and constitutes improper loan servicing practices. 


XXXX. Lack of Transparency and Accountability To date, Aidvantage has failed to provide adequate documentation or a clear explanation for the interest charge. When I requested clarification, they could not provide reliable information or a satisfactory resolution. Their failure to follow up on the promised call-back has left me in a state of uncertainty and concern regarding the accuracy of my loan servicing. This lack of transparency is not only frustrating but also indicative of improper bookkeeping and potentially unlawful practices.

Requested Resolution : 1. Immediate Refund of the {$30.00} in Interest : Refund the amount of {$30.00} that was incorrectly charged to my account, as the SAVE Plan explicitly states that interest should not have accrued. 


XXXX XXXX of XXXX XXXX from XXXX XXXX : XXXX a thorough review of my loan account from XXXX to XX/XX/XXXX to ensure that no additional improper interest has been charged. If further interest charges are identified, I request that they be refunded promptly.

3. Refund of Any Payments Made Toward Improper Interest : Any payments I have made towards the erroneously applied interest, I request that these funds be refunded in full.

4. Written Explanation of Interest Charges : Provide a detailed, written explanation outlining the origin of the interest charges, specifically addressing the {$30.00} that was applied while I was enrolled in the SAVE Plan. 


XXXX. Confirmation of Corrective Actions : Ensure that Aidvantage takes corrective actions to prevent the reoccurrence of this issue for other borrowers and provides me with a formal assurance that this matter has been rectified on my account. 



Conclusion : I believe that the actions taken by Aidvantage are in direct violation of federal regulations, the SAVE Plans provisions, and my rights as a borrower. I respectfully request that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) take immediate action to resolve this issue and ensure that I am refunded the incorrect interest charges and that my loan balance is corrected. 

Additionally, if this matter is not resolved within a reasonable timeframe, I will be pursuing legal action and exploring other avenues to hold Aidvantage accountable for their failure to comply with federal student loan policies and the rights of borrowers like myself. 

Please let me know if any additional information or documentation is required to support this complaint. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I look forward to your response.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Immediate Action Needed : Approve Outstanding Borrower Defense Applications To the Departments Overseeing School & Loan Server Compliance, We are writing as a collective group of defrauded students and alumni who attended XXXXaffiliated schools, urging immediate action to approve outstanding Borrower Defense applications and provide full relief for those impacted. 

Many of us attended the following institutions owned by or affiliated with XXXX, where misrepresentations and predatory practices have been well-documented : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX The Department of Education has already found significant evidence of misconduct by these schools. Specifically, XXXX University misrepresented job placement rates to prospective students between XXXX and XXXX, falsely claiming that 90 % of graduates secured jobs in their field of study within six months of graduation. This claim, widely advertised in national campaigns and direct mailings, was later revealed to be grossly inaccurate. XXXX included old jobs held by mid-career students before enrolling and excluded graduates who found employment outside their field of study. 

At its peak, XXXX enrolled nearly XXXX students across campuses in 26 states and through an online program accessible nationwide. The scale of this deception has left countless students burdened with unmanageable debt and limited opportunities, as documented in the Department of Educations Borrower Defense Executive Summary and Statements of Facts.

We are asking you to take immediate steps to : 1. Approve all outstanding Borrower Defense applications for students who attended these institutions.

2. Discharge all loans associated with fraudulent practices, including consolidated loans.

3. Repair borrowers credit reports to reflect the removal of these fraudulent debts.

Delaying action only prolongs the harm caused by these predatory institutions, leaving borrowers unable to move forward with their lives. Many of us pursued higher education to achieve the American Dream, but this dream was stolen by the very institutions we trusted to help us achieve it.

We implore you to act decisively to ensure justice for all borrowers who were misled and exploited. The stakes are simply too high to risk further delays. 

Thank you for your attention to this urgent matter. 

Sincerely, Students & Graduates of XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
I have been enrolled in the SAVE program since it initiated through Nelnet. I received an email about recertifying my income for my repayment plan which they have a deadline on their website for XX/XX/XXXX. I thought that was weird given the legal status of SAVE currently but did not want to be placed in another program. On XX/XX/XXXX, I did the recertification application and chose to stay on the SAVE program and today ( XX/XX/XXXX ) the said my application could not be processed due to the legalities of the SAVE program and put me in a forbearance program which interest is NOW accruing. I called Nelnet and they said there is nothing they can do, I called student aid.gov and they said they can see my application but can not do anything and should file a complaint. 
On the studentaid.gov resources it clearly states that a servicer will ask for recertification at the earliest XX/XX/XXXX but yet Nelnet has " recertify by XX/XX/XXXX '' at the top of their website AND sent emails.The studentaid.gove website also has an email that states " IF you submit an application to enrolling an IDR plan OTHER than SAVE, but your loan servicer is unable to process your application within 10 business days you will be placed in forbearance ''. However I DID RECERTIFY in the SAVE program that I WAS ALREADY APART OF and was placed into that program. I followed what was required and now I am being financially punished and nothing can be done by either party? Not acceptable. They shoulder not have you recertify if they don't know the status to then put you in a beneficial forbearance program that generates more money for the companies. I want my 0 % interest back and the interest that is accruing wiped from this issue between Nelnets lack of following federal policy and misleading information. 

I have screenshots and saved information of everything stated here and will pursue this until it is corrected.

Consumer complaint narrative:
According to Bidens Student Loan Forgiveness plan, those who were eligible to receive student forgiveness or recipients of XXXX XXXX, XXXX Loans, or XXXX loans. 

Implementing the SAVE plan on a valuable education would be nearly impossible as nearly all financial and economic resources had to be exhausted including parents having to take on second jobs or small business owners working to put their kids through school, only to have those falsehood promises dismissed as false hope. Moreover, its even more saddening and difficult for job seekers who have been out of the workforce to rejoin the private sector or public sector as a civil servant as discriminatory practices by financial institutions charging Usurious rates and engaging in Predatory lending practices to services are ha when in reality, after sending XXXX children to XXXX XXXX XXXX  colleges on roughly half-tuition scholarships, XXXX and XXXX could have provided a bit more private/federal student loans available to make it more accessible for the students not place undue financial burden or hardship on their parents, who would be willing to more money to support them in times of need, whilst jeopardizes their financially security a retirement future, with the implicit and implied social contract to look after them in their old age and ensure that their standard of living was at least as well but no more worse off than before deciding to take on the endeavor of enrolling, attending, and graduating from a world-renowned institution of higher education. In the case where one of the students is unable to obtain gainful employment post graduation, then the family is at risk of bearing an undue burden of debt, so much time money and resources allocated towards that goal and purpose only to have it squandered by the jealousy and envy of peers who believe that their deliberate intentional choice to enroll in an inferior school with inferior rankings according the XXXX and Rankings, should be compensated at least as much as their State school counterparts is simply a matter of pity undue pride or shame on the part of the one who gaslights the ability of the honest hard working American people.

With one or the other child unable to provide or make sufficient income to support not only themselves but be able to afford to live comfortably without having to sacrifice their own health and livelihood to be able to survive.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Immediate Action Needed : Approve Outstanding Borrower Defense Applications To the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, We are writing as a collective group of defrauded students and alumni who attended XXXX schools, urging immediate action to approve outstanding Borrower Defense applications and provide full relief for those impacted. 

Many of us attended the following institutions owned by or affiliated with XXXX, where misrepresentations and predatory practices have been well-documented : * XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  has XXXX found significant evidence of misconduct by these schools. Specifically, XXXX XXXX  misrepresented job placement rates to prospective students between XXXX and XXXX, falsely claiming that 90 % of graduates secured jobs in their field of study within XXXX months of graduation. This claim, widely advertised in national campaigns and direct mailings, was later revealed to be grossly inaccurate. XXXX included old jobs held by mid-career students before enrolling and excluded graduates who found employment outside their field of study. 

At its peak, XXXX enrolled nearly XXXX students across campuses in XXXX states and through an online program accessible nationwide. The scale of this deception has left countless students burdened with unmanageable debt and limited opportunities, as documented in the Department XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Summary and Statements of Facts. 

We are asking you to take immediate steps to : XXXX. Approve all outstanding XXXX XXXX applications for students who attended these institutions. 
XXXX. Discharge all loans associated with fraudulent practices, including consolidated loans. 
XXXX. Repair borrowers credit reports to reflect the removal of these fraudulent debts. 

Delaying action only prolongs the harm caused by these predatory institutions, leaving borrowers unable to move forward with their lives. Many of us pursued higher education to achieve the XXXX XXXX, but this dream was stolen by the very institutions we trusted to help us achieve it. 

We implore you to act decisively to ensure justice for all borrowers who were misled and exploited. The stakes are simply too high to risk further delays. 

Thank you for your attention to this urgent matter. 

Sincerely, Students & Graduates of XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to file a formal complaint against Mohela, my federal loan servicer, regarding their mishandling of my XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, their failure to properly process my request to switch from XXXX to XXXX, and the inadequate customer service I have received. 
I am currently pursuing XXXX and have just XXXX months left to qualify for forgiveness ( XXXX ). However, Mohela has not processed my application request to switch to XXXX, and they have mismanaged my forbearance status. 
According to the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, borrowers who were enrolled in XXXX were placed into a general forbearance which would not count toward XXXX or XXXX  forgiveness. However, time spent in a processing forbearance ( a category Mohela should have already applied in my case ) does count toward XXXX, provided the borrower is in an eligible employment status ( I am employed by the XXXX ). I applied for XXXX XX/XX/year> which according to XXXX should move me into a processing forbearance based on their following website guidance XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX I spoke with a rep who indicated my XXXX forbearance doesn't count for XXXX, which is correct. I attempted to explain that based on the guidelines references above, I should have been moved into a processing forbearance. He transferred me to a supervisory line, and someone was supposed to reach out within a business day. However, I have not heard back. 
Mohela 's phone tree system seems specifically designed to block XXXX candidates from reaching a live rep. I was placed in an endless loop and had to lie on the phone tree to speak to customer service. 
I am frustrated that Mohela is allowed to disregard rules that govern student loan services and fails to take actions on time sensitive request with no repercussions. 
I request immediate clarification and correction of my forbearance status ( from XXXX to processing forbearance ) in line with the XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX rules, retroactive to XX/XX/year>. Mohela also needs to initiate a formal investigation into their customer service practices, especially for XXXX borrowers. The prolonged stonewalling, inaction, and negligence on Mohela 's part is bordering on criminal, and it is directly impacting the lives of millions of borrowers.
Company public response: Company believes it acted appropriately as authorized by contract or law

Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, I am writing to formally lodge a complaint against Mohela concerning their handling of my Loan Discharge applications submitted in XXXX and XXXX of XXXX. Despite the significant time that has elapsed, I have yet to receive any substantive response from Mohela, and it appears they are intentionally stalling the processing of my application. 

Each time I contact Mohela, I am placed on hold for over XXXX hours, only to be subjected to a series of inconsistent responses. On several occasions, Mohela representatives have confirmed the receipt of my application, only to later claim that they can not locate it. This back-and-forth has left me frustrated and without any clear resolution. 

Additionally, Mohela has been deflecting responsibility, instructing me to contact various other agencies, including XXXX and XXXX XXXX, without providing any concrete solutions. They have asserted that the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, the institution in question, is not marked as closed in their system. However, when I contacted XXXX, it was confirmed that the college is indeed closed. This discrepancy suggests a significant lapse in Mohela 's internal systems and coordination. 

The lack of accountability and the continuous redirection between Mohela and other agencies have made it impossible for me to move forward with my application. This situation has not only delayed the process but has also caused unnecessary stress and confusion. 

I urge the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau to investigate this matter thoroughly and hold Mohela accountable for their inadequate handling of loan discharge applications. Borrowers should not be left in limbo, especially when they are following the required procedures and seeking the assistance they are entitled to. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to file a formal complaint against Ascendium Education Solutions regarding their refusal to refund payments totaling {$17000.00} made on a FFELP loan tied to my enrollment at XXXX XXXX XXXX. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX has been widely recognized as engaging in fraudulent and deceptive practices, leading to its closure in XXXX and the discharge of many loans under the Department of Educations Borrower Defense to Repayment program. While my FFELP loan has been discharged, Ascendium, as the guarantor, has retained payments I made from XXXX to XXXX, citing Department of Education policy.

I believe that

Ascendiums retention of these payments is unjust and violates principles of fairness and equity. Their refusal to refund payments effectively enriches them at the expense of a borrower who was misled into incurring debt under false pretenses. I respectfully request that the CFPB investigate this matter and take action to ensure that guarantors like Ascendium are held accountable for refunding payments tied to fraudulent loans.

Consumer complaint narrative:
To the Departments Overseeing School & Loan Server Compliance, We are writing as a collective group of defrauded students and alumni who attended XXXX-affiliated schools, urging immediate action to approve outstanding Borrower Defense applications and provide full relief for those impacted. 
Many of us attended the following institutions owned by or affiliated with XXXX, where misrepresentations and predatory practices have been well-documented : * XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX The Department of Education has already found significant evidence of misconduct by these schools. Specifically, XXXX University misrepresented job placement rates to prospective students between XXXX and XXXX, falsely claiming that 90 % of graduates secured jobs in their field of study within XXXX months of graduation. This claim, widely advertised in national campaigns and direct mailings, was later revealed to be grossly inaccurate. XXXX included old jobs held by mid-career students before enrolling and excluded graduates who found employment outside their field of study. 
At its peak, XXXX enrolled nearly XXXX students across campuses in XXXX states and through an online program accessible nationwide. The scale of this deception has left countless students burdened with unmanageable debt and limited opportunities, as documented in the Department of Educations Borrower Defense Executive Summary and Statements of Facts.

We are asking you to take immediate steps to : 1. Approve all outstanding Borrower Defense applications for students who attended these institutions.

2. Discharge all loans associated with fraudulent practices, including consolidated loans.

3. Repair borrowers credit reports to reflect the removal of these fraudulent debts.

Delaying action only prolongs the harm caused by these predatory institutions, leaving borrowers unable to move forward with their lives. Many of us pursued higher education to achieve the XXXX XXXX, but this dream was stolen by the very institutions we trusted to help us achieve it. 
We implore you to act decisively to ensure justice for all borrowers who were misled and exploited. The stakes are simply too high to risk further delays. 
Thank you for your attention to this urgent matter. 

Sincerely, Students & Graduates of XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX h XXXX Hey! Someone from the XXXX XXXX put this together. It's long, but I think you have post approval on so I can't break it into two parts...

I am giving this signal boost for a group member. If you attended one of theseXX/XX/XXXX- affiliated schools, please consider taking part. These actions take next to no time to complete and the info gathering has already been done for you. 
IMPORTANT **CALL TO ACTION** Our Last Chance before new cabinet members take office ( cabinet members are inaugurated in after President takes office ) Students of ALLXX/XX/XXXX schools are mass-emailing the Department of Education & Filing a Complaint with CFBP today and this week! Do not wait. Do this ASAP on your phone upon reading this thread. All the info is below. This will take only 5 minutes but its vital. This is what other schools did to receive mass loan discharge and it worked. But we need students from ALL XX/XX/XXXX schools.

Template to use is below.

1. File a complaint here ( yes you have to create an account, it takes 1 minute ) : https : //www.consumerfinance.gov/complaint/ 2. Emails : XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX XXXX. Reply to your own BD confirmation email with this template ( or modify as you wish ) Subject : Immediate Action Needed : Approve Outstanding Borrower Defense Applications To the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, We are writing as a collective group of defrauded students and alumni who attended XXXXaffiliated schools, urging immediate action to approve outstanding Borrower Defense applications and provide full relief for those impacted. 
Many of us attended the following institutions owned by or affiliated with XXXX, where misrepresentations and predatory practices have been well-documented : * XXXX University XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX University XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX University XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX University XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX University XXXX XXXX XXXX The Department of Education has already found significant evidence of misconduct by these schools. Specifically, XXXX University misrepresented job placement rates to prospective students between XXXX and XXXX, falsely claiming that 90 % of graduates secured jobs in their field of study within six months of graduation. This claim, widely advertised in national campaigns and direct mailings, was later revealed to be grossly inaccurate. XXXX included old jobs held by mid-career students before enrolling and excluded graduates who found employment outside their field of study. 
At its peak, XXXX enrolled nearly 70,000 students across campuses in 26 states and through an online program accessible nationwide. The scale of this deception has left countless students burdened with unmanageable debt and limited opportunities, as documented in the Department of Educations Borrower Defense Executive Summary and Statements of Facts. 
We are asking you to take immediate steps to : 1. Approve all outstanding Borrower Defense applications for students who attended these institutions.

2. Discharge all loans associated with fraudulent practices, including consolidated loans.

3. Repair borrowers credit reports to reflect the removal of these fraudulent debts.

Delaying action only prolongs the harm caused by these predatory institutions, leaving borrowers unable to move forward with their lives. Many of us pursued higher education to achieve the XXXX Dream, but this dream was stolen by the very institutions we trusted to help us achieve it. 
We implore you to act decisively to ensure justice for all borrowers who were misled and exploited. The stakes are simply too high to risk further delays. 
Thank you for your attention to this urgent matter. 
Sincerely, Students & Graduates of XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear / Consumer Financial Protection Bureau Representative, I am submitting this formal complaint to raise urgent concerns regarding the privacy and security of my personal and financial information associated with my federal student loans. I currently carry a balance exceeding {$50000.00} in federal student debt. 

Recently, I have become deeply concerned that my data, including personal identifiers and financial details connected to my student loan account, may have been compromised, accessed, or mishandled by unauthorized partiesspecifically XXXX XXXX and/or individuals or entities affiliated with him. 

Given XXXX XXXX extensive influence across multiple technology platforms, including his ownership and control over XXXX  ( formerly XXXX ), and his widely reported access to user data, I fear that he or associated parties could have improperly accessed or mishandled my federally protected borrower data. 

This concern is particularly alarming because XXXX XXXX is a private citizen and a nationalized individual from XXXX XXXX, raising additional worries regarding the potential foreign exposure of sensitive U.S. borrower data.

Specific Concerns : Unauthorized access to my personally identifiable information ( PII ) and federal loan records. 
Potential misuse or dissemination of my financial data by foreign or non-governmental entities. 
Emotional distress and ongoing uncertainty about my financial privacy and security. 
While I am not aware of a publicly disclosed breach involving federal borrower data, the pervasive data-sharing practices within large technology corporations under XXXX XXXX ownershipcoupled with his non-U.S. national backgroundhave led me to believe that my information could have been accessed without my consent. 

The possibility of my sensitive financial records being in the possession of non-governmental and potentially foreign entities is deeply distressing and unacceptable. 

Requested Resolution : In light of the serious nature of my privacy concerns, I am requesting the following actions : A formal investigation into whether my federal student loan data has been accessed, compromised, or shared with XXXX XXXX or individuals/entities affiliated with him. 
Verification and assurance that my borrower data remains secure and has not been subject to unauthorized access.

Loan forgiveness or significant reduction as a compensatory measure due to the emotional distress, privacy risk, and potential exposure of my financial information. 
Enhanced safeguards and disclosure transparency regarding third-party access to borrower data, ensuring that non-U.S. citizens or private individuals can not exploit or obtain such information. 
I am seeking prompt action on this matter, as the uncertainty surrounding the security of my financial information places me under continuous emotional and financial strain. I trust that you will treat this matter with the gravity it warrants and provide the necessary remedies. 

Thank you for your attention and swift response. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

To the Departments Overseeing School & Loan Server Compliance, We are writing as a collective group of defrauded students and alumni who attended XXXXaffiliated schools, urging immediate action to approve outstanding Borrower Defense applications and provide full relief for those impacted. 

Many of us attended the following institutions owned by or affiliated with XXXX, where misrepresentations and predatory practices have been well-documented : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX The Department of Education has already found significant evidence of misconduct by these schools. Specifically, XXXXXXXX XXXX misrepresented job placement rates to prospective students between XXXX and XXXX, falsely claiming that 90 % of graduates secured jobs in their field of study within six months of graduation. This claim, widely advertised in national campaigns and direct mailings, was later revealed to be grossly inaccurate. XXXX included old jobs held by mid-career students before enrolling and excluded graduates who found employment outside their field of study. 

At its peak, XXXX enrolled nearly 70,000 students across campuses in 26 states and through an online program accessible nationwide. The scale of this deception has left countless students burdened with unmanageable debt and limited opportunities, as documented in the Department of Educations Borrower Defense Executive Summary and Statements of Facts.

We are asking you to take immediate steps to : 1. Approve all outstanding Borrower Defense applications for students who attended these institutions.

2. Discharge all loans associated with fraudulent practices, including consolidated loans.

3. Repair borrowers credit reports to reflect the removal of these fraudulent debts.

Delaying action only prolongs the harm caused by these predatory institutions, leaving borrowers unable to move forward with their lives. Many of us pursued higher education to achieve the American Dream, but this dream was stolen by the very institutions we trusted to help us achieve it.

We implore you to act decisively to ensure justice for all borrowers who were misled and exploited. The stakes are simply too high to risk further delays.

Thank you for your attention to this urgent matter.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Nelnet loan services sent a single email to an old account that was initially established with Nelnet over 10 years ago, and then charged my account directly without further notification for {$3500.00} overdrafting my account. 

The loan servicer charged an outrageous, unreasonable amount for monthly student load payment and gave no warning other than a single billing statement sent to an old email address that has not been verified in 10 years. 

Nelnet made no effort to contact me or update my email for over 10 years before charging over {$5000.00} to my checking account without approval. Nelnet student loan service is sneaky, abusive wnd predatory. Nelnet also refused to refund or defer my payment even tho I contacted them before the charge has been verified by my bank.

I am one of the students that was apart of the XXXX v XXXX case, in which my student loans were canceled. I applied for student loan forgiveness and cancelation through the XXXX 's default program. The Department of Education owes me {$4600.00} -- since my student loans have been canceled and as part of the XXXX XXXX XXXX case ; all voluntary payments should be returned.

Consumer complaint narrative: FCRA 605 ( a ) ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c ( a ) ) Time Limits on Reporting This section of the FCRA states that negative information ( e.g., late payments, defaults, collections ) can only remain on your credit report for up to 7 years from the date of the first delinquency, while bankruptcies can remain for up to 10 years. However, accounts in good standing may remain on your credit report indefinitely or for a period determined by the credit reporting agency.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Immediate Action Needed : Approve Outstanding Borrower Defense Applications To the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, We are writing as a collective group of defrauded students and alumni who attended XXXX schools, urging immediate action to approve outstanding XXXX XXXX applications and provide full relief for those impacted. 

Many of us attended the following institutions owned by or affiliated with XXXX, where misrepresentations and predatory practices have been well-documented : * XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Department of Education has already found significant evidence of misconduct by these schools. Specifically, XXXX University misrepresented job placement rates to prospective students between XXXX and XXXX, falsely claiming that 90 % of graduates secured jobs in their field of study within XXXX months of graduation. This claim, widely advertised in national campaigns and direct mailings, was later revealed to be grossly inaccurate. XXXX included old jobs held by mid-career students before enrolling and excluded graduates who found employment outside their field of study. 

At its peak, XXXX enrolled nearly XXXX students across campuses in XXXX states and through an online program accessible nationwide. The scale of this deception has left countless students burdened with unmanageable debt and limited opportunities, as documented in the Department of Educations XXXX XXXX XXXX Summary and Statements of Facts. 

We are asking you to take immediate steps to : XXXX. Approve all outstanding XXXX XXXX applications for students who attended these institutions. 
XXXX. Discharge all loans associated with fraudulent practices, including consolidated loans. 
XXXX. Repair borrowers credit reports to reflect the removal of these fraudulent debts. 

Delaying action only prolongs the harm caused by these predatory institutions, leaving borrowers unable to move forward with their lives. Many of us pursued higher education to achieve the XXXX XXXX, but this dream was stolen by the very institutions we trusted to help us achieve it. 

We implore you to act decisively to ensure justice for all borrowers who were misled and exploited. The stakes are simply too high to risk further delays. 

Thank you for your attention to this urgent matter. 

Sincerely, Students & Graduates of XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative: I am writing to get an update on my PSLF Reconsideration Buyback Request that was submitted on XX/XX/XXXX. I have at least 120 months of approved qualifying employment, and I am seeking PSLF or TEPSLF discharge through PSLF buyback. I submitted a PSLF employer certification form on XX/XX/XXXX which was processed on XX/XX/XXXX and my payments were subsequently updated on the FSA website to XXXX eligible/qualifying payment counts. However, I made my final three payments in XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, and XX/XX/XXXX, specifically on the dates of XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX. Unfortunately, I am currently caught up in the SAVE forbearance and understand that payments made during the forbearance period typically do not count toward PSLF, however these final three payments that I made if counted would bring me to 120 payments exactly which would allow me to achieve forgiveness now. This would be achieved through buyback. I also submitted an Income-Driven Repayment ( IDR ) Plan Application on XX/XX/XXXX to switch from SAVE to PAYE as I'm not currently getting any PSLF credit due to being in SAVE forbearance. I did this just in case my buyback request is denied. My IDR Application is still under review. If my PSLF Reconsideration Buyback request is denied and I have to make three additional payments under PAYE, I am completely fine with that but shouldn't have to make any additional payments. I just want to be done and obtain student loan forgiveness/discharge as soon as possible. I would like for MOHELA, FSA and/or the Department of Education ( DOE ) to please review, process and approve my PSLF Reconsideration Buyback Request so that my account can finally be updated to 120 payments resulting in student loan forgiveness/discharge. I am very concerned given the new administration that is set to take office very soon.

Consumer complaint narrative:
To whom it may concern : I am filing a formal complaint regarding improper interest accrual on my student loan account, serviced by Mohela, while I was in forbearance after applying for the Saving on a Valuable Education ( SAVE ) Plan. This complaint concerns {$2700.00}, which was applied to my account despite the Department of Educations directive that forbearance shall not accrue after sixty days of processing. 

Summary of the Complaint : 1. Improper Interest Accrual Despite Administrative Forbearance : I discovered on XX/XX/XXXX that interest had accrued on my account. I had applied for the SAVE plan on XX/XX/XXXX, which would have $ XXXX  monthly payment amount per Federal Student Aid. 
2. Inadequate Response from Loan Servicer : Shortly after discovering the interest charge, I contacted Mohela. A representative assured me that the interest would be removed. However, the charge remains on my account. 
3. Directive from Department of Education : The Department of Education website, updated on XX/XX/XXXX, states : If the borrowers application is not processed by their servicer within 60 days, the borrower will be moved into a general forbearance that does not count toward PSLF or IDR until their application is processed. Interest will not accrue in this general forbearance. Despite this guarantee, interest has continued to accrue on my account. 
4. Violation of Federal Protections : These actions may violate federal laws and regulations, including : o The Higher Education Act of 1965, which governs student loans and protects borrowers rights. 
o The Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), which prohibits unfair debt practices. 
o The Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ), which ensures accurate loan terms disclosure. 
5. Lack of Transparency : Mohela has not provided adequate documentation or a clear explanation for the improper interest charges, leaving me without a resolution. 

Requested Resolution : I respectfully request the following : 1. Immediate Refund of Improperly Charged Interest : Refund charged to my account 2. Adjustment of Interest Rate : Apply 0 % interest rate to my account until SAVE plan litigation is resolved. 
3. Review of Loan Account : Conduct a full review of my account to ensure no additional improper charges.

4. Detailed Explanation : Provide a written explanation of the interest charges and their origin.

5. Preventative Measures : Ensure corrective actions to prevent similar issues for other borrowers. 

Conclusion : I believe Mohelas actions violate federal regulations and borrower protections. If this matter is not resolved promptly, I will pursue legal action and explore other avenues to ensure compliance with the SAVE Plan and federal guidelines. Thank you for your attention to this matter. Please contact me if further information is needed.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing this complaint because I am concerned that my personal and financial student loan information may have been accessed without my consent due to reports that the Department of Government Efficiency ( DOGE ) and XXXX XXXX team were granted access to U.S. Department of Education systems.

Details of My Student Loans Loan Servicer : Aidvantage Loan Type : Federal Direct Loans ( Subsidized & Unsubsidized ) Total Loan Amount : {$39000.00} Number of Loans : 8 loans Schools Attended : XXXX XXXX ( XXXX  ) & XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX First Loan Disbursed : XX/XX/XXXX What Happened On XX/XX/XXXX, I became aware through a XXXX XXXX news report that unauthorized third parties may have had access to borrower information within the U.S. Department of Education.

I have not been notified by my loan servicer or the Department of Education regarding whether my personal data was accessed, shared, or misused.

This raises concerns of a potential violation of the Privacy Act of 1974 and the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act ( FERPA ).

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to bring to your attention a serious issue regarding the mishandling of my student loans by my loan servicer which has resulted in my eligibility for student loan forgiveness being over looked. 
I am very grateful for the programs and initiatives that have been implemented by the Department of Education to provide relief for student loan borrowers. I have began educating myself on the various options available for forgiveness and I believe I meet the criteria for eligibility under the Borrowers Defense program. 
Unfortunately I recently discovered that my loan servicer Navient failed to properly handle my student loans and neglected to consider my eligibility for loan forgiveness despite meeting the criteria. Navient did not provide me with the necessary information, guidance, or assistance needed in pursuing forgiveness options. The mishandling of my loans has caused very significant financial distress and has hindered my ability to achieve financial stability. As a responsible borrower I have fulfilled all obligations required of me. It is very disheartening to realize that my loan servicer 's negligence has resulted in preventing me access to benefits that I am rightfully entitled to. In addition to Navients negligence in assistance with loan forgiveness the servicer has also been extremely negligent in communicating loan terms as well as transfers, this is in addition to the predatory lending practices the servicer has participating in while servicing mine an countless other borrow loans. I am kindly requesting the Department of Education conduct a thorough investigation into this mater and take any and all appropriate action against my loan servicer for their mishandling of my student loans. Additionally, I urge you to please rectify this situation by ensuring that my eligibility for loan forgiveness, as well as any correspondence with my loan servicer that supports my claims. I am more than willing to provide any further information or documentation required to support my case. I trust that the Department of Education will take this matter seriously and address it promptly. I have faith in the system and believe that my concerns will be thoroughly investigated and resolved in a fair and just manner.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally lodge a complaint regarding the unauthorized access and breach of my educational records, financial aid data, and IRS tax information by the U.S. Department of Education ( DOE ) and the Department of Governmental Entities ( DOGE ). This breach constitutes a direct violation of the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act ( FERPA ) and Title IV regulations, as well as an egregious violation of my personal privacy and financial security.

I recently discovered that my sensitive and legally protected records were accessed and potentially shared without my consent. This includes but is not limited to : 1. My academic records and personally identifiable information ( PII ).

2. My Free Application for Federal Student Aid ( FAFSA ) data, including financial aid history and loan information.

3. My IRS tax transcripts, which were obtained and used without proper authorization.

These actions violate my rights under FERPA ( 20 U.S.C. 1232g ; 34 CFR Part 99 ), which grants me the right to control access to my educational records, as well as Title IV of the Higher Education Act, which governs the use and protection of federal student aid information. Furthermore, unauthorized access to my IRS tax data raises serious concerns regarding potential identity theft, fraud, and violations of federal data security standards.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/year>, I applied for loan consolidation and an income-driven repayment ( XXXX ) plan through MOHELA, intending to pursue Public Service XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ). Despite submitting my application promptly, MOHELA did not respond for several months, causing significant delays. On XX/XX/year>, I was informed that my loans had been placed into forbearance. This delay, which lasted over XXXX months, was not caused by me but resulted in significant financial repercussions. 

During the extended processing period, my loans accrued interest. As a first-year resident with a limited salary, I planned to make affordable payments under an XXXX plan. However, MOHELAs delays prevented me from doing so. This is particularly concerning because my future payments under an IDR plan will likely be higher due to anticipated increases in income after completing my residency. The delay has disrupted my financial planning and undermined my efforts to manage my debt responsibly. 

Furthermore, MOHELA placed my loans in processing forbearance rather than administrative forbearance. This distinction is critical because processing forbearance allowed interest to accrue, increasing my loan balance through no fault of my own. Since I was not given the option to make payments during this period, it is unfair that interest accumulated. This practice feels misleading and exacerbates the already significant financial burden of medical training.

I logged on today ( XX/XX/year> ) to view what I owe. There is an outstanding balance, but none of the loans show my amounts. Back in XXXX, I saw the same view, and thought I was one of the students whose loan is forgiven under the Biden administration since I am in the PSLF.

They have handled my case irresponsibly during the resuming of payments and I should be held harmless ( or owe anything ) according to my records and good standing. 

Regards, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
I graduated from XXXX XXXX in 1997, which is XXXX  years ago, and despite my best efforts to meet my loan obligations, I have been unable to repay my student loans in full. Over the past XXXX  years, I have encountered multiple life challenges that have made it extremely difficult for me to maintain regular payments My financial situation became particularly strained when I had to file for bankruptcy and then my ex-husband was incarcerated. As the sole provider for my family during that time, I was faced with the heavy responsibility of supporting my children and myself. Despite working multiple jobs, including pursuing a career in teaching, the compensation was insufficient to cover both my living expenses and my student loan payments. As a result, I was forced to explore alternative job paths in order to provide for my family, but unfortunately, these jobs did not offer enough financial stability to allow me to continue paying off my loans. 

In addition to the hardship of being a single provider, I have struggled with the long term consequences of the economic turndown and rising living cost, sending children to school, which have further impeded my ability to meet financial obligations. While I have worked diligently to manage my finances and pay off my student loans, the burden has been overwhelming. 

Given my long history of financial struggles, coupled with my sincere commitment to rebuilding my financial future, I am requesting loan forgiveness or relief under any hardship programs. I am hopeful that with your support I can begin a new chapter of financial freedom, as I am committed to improving my situation and achieving greater financial stability in the future. 

I, thank you for your time and consideration of my request. I look forward to your understanding and hope for a favorable resolution to my case. 

Sincerely.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Starting in XXXX I have contacted Student aid.gov to make sure that my loans were set to be forgiven in XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX I called weekly and spoke with representatives who confirmed that according to my payments that it would qualify for 120 payments in XXXX. In XXXX I was told that my XX/XX/XXXX payment would not qualify as XXXX placed me in forbearance. I was not aware my account was in forbearance until XX/XX/XXXX. I contacted both XXXX and XXXX XXXX customer service and was notified my XXXX and XXXX months would qualify towards the 120 payments. I was advised to request a refund of my XXXX payment. I requested the payment in XXXX and was informed it would take 45 days to process payment. In the meantime I contacted student gov each week to ensure in the meantime my Pslf certifications would be received. I was then informed to suit the forms digitally instead of upload to the website as my requests had been pending since XX/XX/XXXX. Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally lodge a complaint regarding the unauthorized access and breach of my educational records, financial aid data, and IRS tax information by the U.S. Department of Education ( DOE ) and the Department of Governmental Entities ( DOGE ). This breach constitutes a direct violation of the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act ( FERPA ) and Title IV regulations, as well as an egregious violation of my personal privacy and financial security. 

I recently discovered that my sensitive and legally protected records were accessed and potentially shared without my consent. This breach has caused significant distress and concern regarding the security of my personal and financial data. This includes but is not limited to : 1. My academic records and personally identifiable information ( PII ).

2. My Free Application for Federal Student Aid ( FAFSA ) data, including financial aid history and loan information. 
3. My IRS tax transcripts, which were obtained and used without proper authorization. 
These actions violate my rights under FERPA ( 20 U.S.C. 1232g ; 34 CFR Part 99 ), which grants me the right to control access to my educational records, as well as Title IV of the Higher Education Act, which governs the use and protection of federal student aid information. Furthermore, unauthorized access to my IRS tax data raises serious concerns regarding potential identity theft, fraud, and violations of federal data security standards.
